See the attached simple source code.

When dragging one of the labels toward the end of the scrollable area it will scroll further down, but stop scrolling before you are anywhere near the end of the scrollable container.

issues.body:
Original [issue 1397](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1397) created by codenameone on 2015-03-15T23:54:25.000Z:

Only applies to new iOS vm.
Does not crash on Android, simulator, or old iOS vm.

Crash is intermittent, and reproducibility is variable - some devices crash with regular frequency, some do not.  Cannot seem to reproduce the crash on XCode simulators at all, only on physical devices.

Crash occurs in several different lines/places, but the common element appears to be operations on Java Object arrays (gcMarkObject/gcMarkArrayObject, function calls which return the array, object_wait, etc.).

In every case, the iOS implementation's of the array or the array's parent appears to be wrong in one or more ways...

For instance,

In one crash,
the the array member's _codenameOneParentClsReference.markFunction is pointing at a class__java_lang_String object in one crash, not a function.

In another crash, _codenameOneParentClsReference.clsName = "char[]" and the _codenameOneParentClsReference.primitiveType = 1 (true), when the actual class of the parent object is one of the app's POJO classes (which contains the returned array), not a char[].

See attached for XCode screenshots of 2 different crashes.
issues.title: iOS new vm builds crash with EXC_BAD_ACCESS ( possible POJO Array memory issue? )

issues.body:
Original [issue 1379](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1379) created by codenameone on 2015-02-27T12:21:53.000Z:

com.codename1.ui.Container.Anim.animate() throws an java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException when a component is added to the animated Container whilst an animation is already registered.
The XXX is thrown when it accesses the motions array for a component which did not yet exist when the animation was registered. 

it does this continuously because the animation never finishes because of the exception. 

I suggest that the animate() method should be wrapped in a try-catch block and that the animation is cancelled in case of an exception.

I also suggest that the animate() method only iterates over as many entries as the motions array contains - use motions.length instead of componentCount. Either this or - another solution was to integrate the new component(s) in the animation by extending the animations arrays.

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Fix for regression with showing text fields in iPad on iOS 7.  This is tested in simulator with following combinations:
iPad Air iOS 7.1 - Orientation locked to landscape, locked to portrait, and no orientation lock.
iPad Air iOS 8.1 - Orientation locked to landscape, locked to portrait, and no orientation lock.
iPad Air iOS 8.2 - Orientation locked to landscape, locked to portrait, and no orientation lock.
iPhone 4s iOS 7.1 - All orientation settings
iPhone 4s iOS 8.1 - All orientation settings
iPhone 4s iOS 8.2 - All orientation settings.
This is related to issue https://github.com/codenameone/CodenameOne/issues/1377
and it fixes a regression that was likely caused by this commit
https://github.com/codenameone/CodenameOne/issues/1377#issuecomment-95731988
Removed some more extraneous debugging variables from last fix for issue #1377
Fix for issue https://github.com/codenameone/CodenameOne/issues/1377

issues.title: re-register push notification

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Fixed issue with NSString failing silently on data with the wrong encoding.  Related to https://github.com/codenameone/CodenameOne/issues/1372.

Created native implementations for some of the heavier used String and StringBuilder methods.  These changes were tested against https://github.com/codenameone/CodenameOne/issues/1372 .  The 15.5 meg input file now loads in 55 seconds on iPhone 4S on NewVM.  Amazingly XMLVM still runs it in 48 seconds - even though most of the hard-hitting methods are written in Java.

issues.title: Excessive WAKEUPS with new iOS VM
issues.body:
Original [issue 1373](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1373) created by codenameone on 2015-02-25T18:17:57.000Z:

The attached app runs fine, there is no issue as far as the user is concerned.

However after running the app there is a crash log on the device:

Exception Type:  EXC_RESOURCE
Exception Subtype: WAKEUPS
Exception Message: (Limit 150/sec) Observed 1081/sec over 300 secs
Triggered by Thread:  5 

In order to run this app you will need to set the property ios.fileSharingEnabled to true and you will need to copy the sample data file to the app on your device using iTunes.

Run the app and click on start. When the import completes, check the device for a crash log.

Sample program, test data file and crash log attached.

Original [issue 1372](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1372) created by codenameone on 2015-02-24T21:53:20.000Z:

Sample program attached.

You must build this app with ios.application_exits=false so that it continues to run in the background.

Run app and it will display a dialog at startup. Click OK and the list is displayed.

At this point you can hit Home, then touch the app icon again to bring the app back. I have done this repeatedly without a problem.

Scroll the list, hit Home. The app has crashed. If you touch the app icon again, the dialog is displayed indicating that the app has been restarted.

Another scenario, start the app, click OK, scroll the list, hit Home. Bring the app back and everything is OK. Scroll the list a little more, hit Home. The app has crashed.

It seems related to scrolling the list.
issues.title: Hitting Home after scrolling a list can crash an app with new iOS VM

issues.body: Original [issue 1369](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1369) created by codenameone on 2015-02-24T01:39:06.000Z: Please clearly state whether the issue relates to a device/the simulator or the tools. If related to a device be sure to specify exactly which device with as much details as possible. iOS bug only. Simulator and Android work as expected. What steps will reproduce the problem? Easiest and clearest example is for GMT... 1. TimeZone gmtTZ = TimeZone.getTimeZone("GMT"); 2. int offset = gmtTZ.getRawOffset(); 3. examine raw offset value What is the expected output? Expect that the offset is 0 for GMT What do you see instead? offset = your device's TimeZone's offset ( e.g. -28800000 if your device's TimeZone is "America/Los_Angeles" ). Note, doesn't matter which TimeZone instance is selected in step 1, the result will always be the device's current TimeZone's offset.
issues.title: iOS only - TimeZone getRawOffset() always returns device's TimeZone offset, regardless of specific TimeZone instance used

issues.body:
Original [issue 1362](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1362) created by codenameone on 2015-02-18T21:58:32.000Z:

The scenario here is very similar to the import problems you have been working on, the difference is that instead of reading from a file installed on the device, we are reading the same data over the network from a PC application. Unfortunately that prevents me from creating a test case.

This is a regression, this function was working with the new iOS VM. Now that the file imports seem to be working fine, I can no longer use the network connection.

When I run my application on my iPod it seems to run into a problem at the same point every time, however the symptoms are different, sometimes it will lock up, sometimes it will crash.

Building the generated source code on Xcode, I see the same problem and again sometimes it locks up, sometimes it crashes. When it locks up Xcode shows memory use is constant and the CPU is running at 5%.

When it crashes it is on the assert in the following method:

void initMethodStack(CODENAME_ONE_THREAD_STATE, JAVA_OBJECT __cn1ThisObject, int stackSize, int localsStackSize, int classNameId, int methodNameId) {
# ifdef CN1_INCLUDE_NPE_CHECKS

```
if(__cn1ThisObject == JAVA_NULL) {
    THROW_NULL_POINTER_EXCEPTION();
}
```
# endif

```
memset(&threadStateData->threadObjectStack[threadStateData->threadObjectStackOffset], 0, sizeof(struct elementStruct) * (localsStackSize + stackSize));
threadStateData->threadObjectStackOffset += localsStackSize + stackSize;
CODENAME_ONE_ASSERT(threadStateData->callStackOffset < CN1_MAX_STACK_CALL_DEPTH - 1);
threadStateData->callStackClass[threadStateData->callStackOffset] = classNameId;
threadStateData->callStackMethod[threadStateData->callStackOffset] = methodNameId;
threadStateData->callStackOffset++;
```

}

I have some basic logging built into my app and it shows that we are connecting and receive the first few segments of the data, then it either hangs or crashes at the         networkManager.addToQueueAndWait(_connectionRequest);

Here is the log from a crash:

issues.body: Original [issue 1361](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1361) created by codenameone on 2015-02-18T18:51:32.000Z: Please clearly state whether the issue relates to a device/the simulator or the tools. If related to a device be sure to specify exactly which device with as much details as possible. All platforms return a different format for returned local file paths. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Use one of the Capture class captureXX methods or Display's openImageGallery, or any method that returns a local file path string 2 3. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected: That the output will be in a single consistent format across all device types, including the simulator... preferably either a correctly formatted file scheme URI or a non-URI root-relative path. Instead, you see: simulator: file://<path to file> iOS: file:/<path to file> android: <path to file> Side note, iOS produces what is technically an invalid URL (file scheme is "file://" not "file:/" What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Current version, operating systems mentioned above. Please provide any additional information below.
issues.title: File path formats vary depending on platform

issues.body: Original [issue 1360](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1360) created by codenameone on 2015-02-17T23:22:09.000Z: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.write a string with an emoji in a TextField or in a TextArea 2.tap "Done" on the virtual keyboard What is the expected output? What do you see instead? the string should appear as typed instead: _ if the emoji is the last char, then all the string is deleted _ if the emoji isn't the last char, then the last char is deleted(even if my post in Facebook show an unknown char glyph as last char, as if it isn't deleted but wrongly coded...) What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? last codenameone on iOS 6.1 Please provide any additional information below.

Original [issue 1346](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1346) created by codenameone on 2015-02-13T04:58:15.000Z:

The new VM GC sleeps at most for 30 seconds. When the app is in the background or allocations are very low in size we should hibernate the GC so it will sleep more and won't take up CPU thus possibly triggering an app kill.
issues.title: The New VM GC never truly sleeps

If related to a device be sure to specify exactly which device with as much details as possible. This is an issue only on the new iOS 64-bit VM (works fine on simulator, android, and old 32-bit iOS vm builds) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create a URI object with a valid URL string argument 2. Call any of the getter methods (except getScheme() which works as expected) 3. Examine the resulting string (or int for port). What is the expected output? each getter call returns the URI part requested (host, path, port, query, etc.) What do you see instead? returns a null for all parts except the scheme What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Latest version, bug only shows on new 64-bit iOS VM

Original [issue 1339](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1339) created by codenameone on 2015-02-06T23:21:17.000Z:

This is a continuation of issue 1304. The old test program submitted with 1304 served its purpose and now runs after the gc changes made. However my real app still has problems. This is a new test app to reproduce the problem.

In order to run this app you will need to set the property ios.fileSharingEnabled to true and you will need to copy the sample data file to the app on your device using iTunes.

The attached program causes the new iOS VM to run out of memory and crash. Run the program, select Start and then Import. The first time you do this it should work. When it finishes, repeat the above steps and it should crash.

The key to getting this process to crash was moving to a second form. I had the same ImportThread in the main form and it would run fine. But after moving it to a second form it started to crash. My real app uses a second form.

I have run this same app 10 times in a row on the old VM without a problem.
issues.title: Sample program that crashes the new iOS VM, Part 2

Application server is set to response with error code, lets say error 500. 2. Mobile application shows a dialog of error 500 and asks to either "Cancel" or "Retry". 3. Meanwhile (while dialog is been shown and nothing is clicked yet) application server is set to respond with proper response again. 4. "Retry" is clicked. 5. Old request is sent and is properly responded by the application server. 6. A new request is made, nothing happens. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? issues.body:
Original [issue 1327](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1327) created by codenameone on 2015-01-31T01:57:36.000Z:

Responsiveness on new vm is noticeably slower than on the old vm.  I will post a simple sample app to demonstrate - right now I'm using some real-world apps and noticing this.

Steps:
1. A list with a custom renderer (just an image and text) with enough items to scroll ( at least 20 or so).
2. Scroll list up and down with index finger at varying speeds.

In old VM the list scroll is quite responsive, staying with the finger.
On new VM the list scroll is laggy, often times a full up-down movement behind.

This issue should lead to two activities:
1.  Work on improving graphics pipeline efficiency.
2. Work on improving performance of VM in general.
issues.title: Graphics performance on NewVM laggy.

issues.body: Original [issue 1324](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1324) created by codenameone on 2015-01-30T15:49:09.000Z: I noticed some bugs in the SEBrowserComponent of the JavaSE port which are affecting the simulator and desktop versions. Replacing WebBrowser with an other component and vice verca: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. create a Form with a WebBrowser component 2. replace the WebBrowser component with a label 3. replace the label with the WebBrowser What is the expected output? What do you see instead? After replacing the WebBrowser it enters the lightweight mode in which only an image of the browser is displayed, after replacing the component with the WebBrowser it doesn't leave the lightweight mode and therefore keeps displaying the image. Browser hasForward: the hasForward function of the JavaSE port checks its current history position against the maximum number of entries, which is 99, and returns everytime true if the current position is lower than that. The last one isn't really a bug, it's just that the WebBrowser won't update its peer image after the first successful creation. This leads to the WebBrowser always using the same image for a transition or if its in the background. In the attachment is a test case which covers the two bugs, there is also a patch to fix these.
issues.title: Bugs in the SEBrowserComponent
GC does not seem to work any more with the iOS newVM
String type is a problem in general with the new iOS VM - StringUtil.replaceAll() and backslash \

issues.body:
Original [issue 1320](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1320) created by codenameone on 2015-01-28T18:37:51.000Z:

Currently DUP_X1 and DUP2_X1 are implemented by the same macro:
# define BC_DUP2_X1() {\

```
stack[stackPointer].data.l = stack[stackPointer - 1].data.l; \
stack[stackPointer - 1].data.l = stack[stackPointer - 2].data.l; \
stack[stackPointer - 2].data.l = stack[stackPointer].data.l; \
stack[stackPointer].type = stack[stackPointer - 1].type; \
stack[stackPointer - 1].type = stack[stackPointer - 2].type; \
stack[stackPointer - 2].type = stack[stackPointer].type; \
safeRetain(&stack[stackPointer]); \
safeRetain(&stack[stackPointer - 1]); \
stackPointer++; \
```

DUP_X1 should work fine with this because it should only be used for single word items anyways.  DUP2_X1 might be problematic though.

From The docs for DUP2_X1:
http://cs.au.dk/~mis/dOvs/jvmspec/ref--12.html

"""
Duplicates the top two-word item on the stack and inserts the duplicate before the previous (single-word) item on the stack. Alternatively, this instruction could also be used to duplicate two single-word items and insert them before the third single-word item on the stack.
"""

This macro may fail in the case where it is duplicating two single-word items.   I think we need to check the types and copy two items instead of just one if the top item is a single-word item.

This means that we should break DUP2_X1 and DUP_X1 into separate macros again also.
issues.title: NewVM: Incorrect DUP2_X1 instruction

Original [issue 1317](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1317) created by codenameone on 2015-01-27T23:03:27.000Z:

I have a database app that has problems running under the new iOS VM. 

I query the database and display the results in a list. I store text information in the database, if the text contains accented characters then when I display the results in the list each accented character is displayed as two question marks.

I have created a test program to reproduce this problem. This app runs fine in the simulator and it runs fine on the device when built with the old iOS VM. When built with the new VM, the data is corrupted. 

The text used in this test program is "Déjà Vu".

I have attached a screenshot of the app built with the new VM showing the problem and the test code needed to reproduce it.
issues.title: Problems storing accented characters in database with new iOS VM

Original [issue 1313](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1313) created by codenameone on 2015-01-26T19:25:40.000Z:

In the new VM, the JSONParser class parses some numerical data incorrectly.  E.g.

public static final String PERIOD_DATA =
        "{"synobsysNacalculatiePerWeekItems": [\n" +
        "  {\n" +
        "    "boekjaar": 2015,\n" +
        "    "medewerker": "GRM4",\n" +
        "    "periode": 4,\n" +
        "    "verwerkt": false,\n" +
        "    "totaalGeboekteUren": 40\n" +
        "  }";

Will be parsed as 
{synobsysNacalculatiePerWeekItems=[{boekjaar=2015.000000, medewerker=GRM4, periode=4.000000, verwerkt=false, totaalGeboekteUren=0.400000}

Notice that "40" is parsed as 0.4.   Interestingly it parsed "4" correctly as 4.0.

Parsing works correctly on the simulator and the Old VM.  This issue was reported in the forum also
http://www.codenameone.com/discussion-forum.html?place=msg%2Fcodenameone-discussions%2F6wpa-W0GQYs%2FyGN5x_A1R-oJ
issues.title: NewVM: parseJSON returns wrong data

issues.body:
Original [issue 1312](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1312) created by codenameone on 2015-01-26T17:44:38.000Z:

I have been experiencing an odd behaviour in my recents builds that did not happen before. Whenever I try to edit a Textfield and write into it, the app freezes. Only happens on iOS, not on Android nor simulator.

I have been able to narrow down the problem and create a test case. Steps to reproduce the problem.
- Create a Form with a Tab Container
- In one Tab, do the following:
  
  Create a BoxLayout Y Container and make it ScrollableY
  
  Place a TextField into it
- In the other tab, just add a List (no need to attach any Renderer to it)

And that´s it. The app will freeze if you try to write in the TextField.

I have only tested with the old vm, so I don´t know if it is reproducible with the new one. That´s why I have not filed an issue on this.
issues.title: Editing Textfield freezes app on iOS

issues.body: Original [issue 1310](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1310) created by codenameone on 2015-01-26T15:13:15.000Z: On both simulator and iOS builds, TextField's setVerticalAlignment has no affect on the vertical alignment of the text What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create a TextField object 2. Set TextField's setVerticalAlignment to CENTER What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected: TextField's text should be center aligned Result: TextField's text is Top aligned What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Please provide any additional information below.
issues.title: vertical alignment in TextField doesn't work

issues.body: Original [issue 1309](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1309) created by codenameone on 2015-01-25T14:42:04.000Z: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Set the back command of a Form using setBackCommand() 2. Try to get the back command which was set using getBackCommand() What is the expected output? What do you see instead? I expect to receive the back command which was set, but I receive null instead. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? The latest. Windows 7.
issues.title: Form getBackCommand() method returns null after having called setBackCommand()
new String(byte[]) constructor - bad bug in new VM on IOS

issues.body: Original [issue 1307](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1307) created by codenameone on 2015-01-24T22:01:59.000Z: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Disable elimination of unused methods in build server. 2. Create basic hello world app. 3. Send iOS debug build What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Should build successfully. Actual result is build error: Ld build/Release-iphoneos/DMTest.app/DMTest normal armv7 cd /var/folders/k7/b5qdhxt88v58wp008k8yxy180000gn/T/build8339543568809164885xxx/dist export IPHONEOS_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=6.0 export PATH="/Applications/Xcode6.1.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneOS.platform/Developer/usr/bin:/Applications/Xcode6.1.app/Contents/Developer/usr/bin:/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin" /Applications/Xcode6.1.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/clang -arch armv7 -isysroot /Applications/Xcode6.1.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneOS.platform/Developer/SDKs/iPhoneOS8.1.sdk -L/var/folders/k7/b5qdhxt88v58wp008k8yxy180000gn/T/build8339543568809164885xxx/dist/build/Release-iphoneos -L/var/folders/k7/b5qdhxt88v58wp008k8yxy180000gn/T/build8339543568809164885xxx/dist/DMTest-src -F/var/folders/k7/b5qdhxt88v58wp008k8yxy180000gn/T/build8339543568809164885xxx/dist/build/Release-iphoneos -filelist /var/folders/k7/b5qdhxt88v58wp008k8yxy180000gn/T/build8339543568809164885xxx/dist/build/DMTest.build/Release-iphoneos/DMTest.build/Objects-normal/armv7/DMTest.LinkFileList -dead_strip -fobjc-link-runtime -miphoneos-version-min=6.0 -framework OpenGLES -framework CoreGraphics -framework UIKit -framework GLKit -framework Foundation -liconv -framework AdSupport -framework AddressBookUI -framework SystemConfiguration -framework MapKit -framework AudioToolbox -lxml2 -framework QuartzCore -framework AddressBook -lsqlite3 -lsqlite3.0 -framework GameKit -framework Security -framework StoreKit -framework CoreMotion -framework CoreLocation -framework MessageUI -framework MediaPlayer -framework AVFoundation -framework CoreVideo -framework QuickLook -framework iAd -framework CoreMedia -lz -lzbar -Xlinker -dependency_info -Xlinker /var/folders/k7/b5qdhxt88v58wp008k8yxy180000gn/T/build8339543568809164885xxx/dist/build/DMTest.build/Release-iphoneos/DMTest.build/Objects-normal/armv7/DMTest_dependency_info.dat -o /var/folders/k7/b5qdhxt88v58wp008k8yxy180000gn/T/build8339543568809164885xxx/dist/build/Release-iphoneos/DMTest.app/DMTest Undefined symbols for architecture armv7: "_java_lang_Object_finalize__", referenced from: _com_codename1_impl_ios_IOSImplementation_TextureAlphaMask_finalize__ in com_codename1_impl_ios_IOSImplementation_TextureAlphaMask.o ld: symbol(s) not found for architecture armv7 Please use labels and text to provide additional information. The finalize() method of the TextureAlphaMask() method is: @Override protected void finalize() throws Throwable { dispose(); super.finalize(); } i.e. it calls super.finalize(). In the old iOS port, the finalize method existed. I could just eliminate this call, but does that mean that the GC doesn't call the finalizers? There is some cleanup here that relies on the finalizer being called. If finalizers aren't called, we will have memory leaks building up. (Note: This problem is only present if elimination of unused methods is disabled... but that was the point. I want to run across errors like this).
issues.title: Undefined symbols for architecture armv7:   "_java_lang_Object_finalize__"

issues.body: Original [issue 1306](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1306) created by codenameone on 2015-01-24T06:26:11.000Z: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Add a Toolbar to a Form 2. Set a back command to the toolbar: tb.addCommandToLeftBar(cmdBack); 3. Add menu commands to the toolbar: tb.addCommandToOverflowMenu(cmd1); 4. Run the application in the simulator 5. Navigate to a form other than the original to which the toobar was added 6. Select the menu command. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? I expect the dialog for the menu command to display items, but instead I get an exception. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? The most current. Windows 7. Please provide any additional information below. java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: margin cannot be negative at com.codename1.ui.plaf.Style.setMargin(Style.java:1623) at com.codename1.ui.Form.showModal(Form.java:1581) at com.codename1.ui.Dialog.showModal(Dialog.java:1089) at com.codename1.ui.Dialog.show(Dialog.java:470) at com.codename1.ui.Dialog.show(Dialog.java:414) at com.codename1.ui.Toolbar.showOverflowMenu(Toolbar.java:257) at com.codename1.ui.Toolbar$ToolbarSideMenu.showMenuDialog(Toolbar.java:541) at com.codename1.ui.MenuBar.showMenu(MenuBar.java:708) at com.codename1.ui.Toolbar$ToolbarSideMenu$2.actionPerformed(Toolbar.java:488) at com.codename1.ui.Form.dispatchCommand(Form.java:1318) at com.codename1.ui.SideMenuBar$CommandWrapper$ShowWaiter.run(SideMenuBar.java:1554) at com.codename1.ui.Display.processSerialCalls(Display.java:1110) at com.codename1.ui.Display.edtLoopImpl(Display.java:1054) at com.codename1.ui.Display.mainEDTLoop(Display.java:960) at com.codename1.ui.RunnableWrapper.run(RunnableWrapper.java:120) at com.codename1.impl.CodenameOneThread.run(CodenameOneThread.java:176)

issues.body:
Original [issue 1304](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1304) created by codenameone on 2015-01-23T22:53:30.000Z:

The first time you run one of my apps it has to obtain data. this is normally done over the network but can also be done with a file copied to the device. Either way if the dataset is a small one, my apps work. However larger datasets consistently crash the new VM.

In trying to narrow down the problem and create a test case I have come to the conclusion that it is not a particular operation that is causing the crash but the load.

The sample program attached will read lines from a file and run them through your CSVParser. It crashes before completion. In order to run this app you will need to set the property ios.fileSharingEnabled to true and you will need to copy the sample data file to the app on your device using iTunes.

This app runs fine on the old VM, it also runs a lot faster on the old VM, it takes about 18 seconds to complete. On the new VM it takes 38 seconds to crash without completing.

This initial data load is key to my apps and so I can't really test my apps at all on the new VM because I can't get any data to them.

I have attached the sample program, the data file you will need to run the program and the crash log I received from my iPod.
issues.title: Sample program to crash ios.newVM

issues.body:
Original [issue 1299](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1299) created by codenameone on 2015-01-22T04:40:27.000Z:

I am using a couple of String constructors that are not working in the new iOS VM:

String(byte[] bytes, int off, int len, String enc)
Construct a new String by converting the specified subarray of bytes using the specified character encoding.

String(byte[] bytes, int off, int len)
Construct a new String by converting the specified subarray of bytes using the platform's default character encoding.

Sample code attached. If you run it on the old VM you will get the expected results.

If you run it on the new VM the offset is being ignored:

```
String str = "This1234 is a test string";
byte[] bytes = str.getBytes();

String str2 = new String(bytes, 4, 4);
```

With the old VM str2 contains 1234 as expected. 

With the new VM str2 contains This

There are other String constructors that take an offset, I have not checked them. The above constructor with character encoding I use quite a bit.
issues.title: String constructors not working correctly with ios.newVM

After installing Eclipse, CN1, Java, etc. I started the Hello World project.Everything worked great until I tried to do a build for Android. At that point I got the following build error: 

BUILD FAILED

I am running on Eclipse with the CN1 version I downloaded early last week.

Since I had seen on several forums that it might be a problem with JDK version 1.8, I downloaded Java JDK version 1.7.0_71

I tried (I think) the solutions described in several of the forums, such as adjusting the Ant path, changing the JAVA_HOME variable, etc. I still get the identical error.

Original [issue 1292](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1292) created by codenameone on 2015-01-16T20:10:11.000Z:

See: http://servermule.webbtide.com/cn1.html

Actions are:
1. press right hamburger menu -> menu slides out correctly
2. press hardware back button -> menu closes correctly
3. press hardware menu/options button -> blank menu opens from left

Seems to have same behaviour on a number of Android devices, so as far as I can tell is a generic device issue.

Using a left hand side hamburger menu with the exact same actions works correctly: http://servermule.webbtide.com/cn1_lhs.html

Attached screenshot shows the Constants used for the right-side menu app.
issues.title: Right Side Menu does not open correctly using Android menu/options button

issues.body:
Original [issue 1291](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1291) created by codenameone on 2015-01-16T11:32:34.000Z:

Steps to reproduce:
1a. Set the text of dialogs.
1b. Write text in textbox and move away.
1c. Write to Storage and read back.
2.  Use special chars like å, ä or ö (and maybe others like é, à)
3.  Compile iOS debug.
4.  Install on iPhone5

The expected output is to get the same chars as result from inserted/written chars.
Instead the chars gets scrambled, the result differs depending of which of 1a, 1b or 1c
Example:
1a if you have ä in a string in code it produces \ä in dialogs
1b if you enter å in a textbox and you move away it gets replaced with [?][?].
1c if you write åäö to Storage as a string like this:
  String orgString = "åäö";
  stor.writeObject("testString", orgString);
  String testString = (String)stor.readObject("testString");
  Dialog.show("Test", "testString: " + testString, "OK", "Avbryt");
  This shows the text:
  testString: \\å\äö

OS: Windows 8.1
Dev: Netbeans IDE 8.0.2

Device: iPhone 5
iOS: 8.1.2

Temporary solution is to use the old iOS VM by adding ios.newVM=false to the project properties build hints.
issues.title: Error with special characters with new iOS WM
Strings appended after £ disappear on iPhone4 using new iOS VM

Original [issue 1282](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1282) created by codenameone on 2015-01-14T13:49:55.000Z:

My mobile app communicates with my desktop app and transfers data from the desktop. Using the new iOS VM this sometimes works and sometimes crashes the VM. It seems to be data related but consistent, the datasets that work, always work, the datasets that fail always fail at the same point. 

I am focusing on one dataset where it consistently crashes the VM at the same point in the app.

I have successfully transferred the exact same data using the old VM, Android and in simulator. I also tried building my app sources in Xcode and running it on my Mac, it completed normally. The only place it crashes is on the device when I build with the new VM. My app is running displaying a progress bar, then I am back on the home screen.

I cleared out all the logs from my device. Then I ran my app to reproduce the problem. When I reconnected my device, there were two new logs, both with the same date and time. I only ran the app the one time, I don't know why there are two logs.

The logs are meaningless to me.

I can't produce a test case for this as it does require my app running on the desktop with a particular set of data.

I have attached both logs, I hope you can get something from them. I have run my app under the debugger in the simulator, there doesn't appear to be anything unusual going on.

issues.body:
Original [issue 1280](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1280) created by codenameone on 2015-01-13T22:32:32.000Z:

Notes sent to Shai:

I just took this DBDemo - https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/source/browse/trunk/Demos/SQLSample/src/com/codename1/db/DBDemo.java

Running on the oldVM CPU use when idle doesn't even register on the activity monitor trace highlights.  Running on the newVM the demo uses 100%+ CPU.  If you leave it idle on the newVM for a minute or two then it will take a long time to respond to touch events.

Adding or deleting rows on both VMs show a spike in CPU and sometimes an increase in memory, but the oldVM is sitting under 20% where as the newVM goes well over 100%.

I'm seeing the knock on effect of in an app that uses a number of automated actions on the database when it starts up is that CPU can spike to > 200% and memory can increase beyond what the device can support causing a crash.  The DBDemo.java shows the issue but not to the same level as a full app.
issues.title: DataBase access on newVM - very high CPU use.

issues.body: Original [issue 1267](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1267) created by codenameone on 2015-01-08T07:51:58.000Z: Delay time in Label tickering can be set but not the amount of pixel the text should shift. What do you see instead? I expect the tickering speed to be consistent across different devices, most importantly... faster on high dpi devices.

Original [issue 1261](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1261) created by codenameone on 2015-01-07T06:56:43.000Z:

What I've discovered is that on the newVM the inputstream reader seems to not return -1 for the end of the file consistently.  When that happens the CSV Parser reads too far into the buffer and returns characters from elsewhere in the file. 

This only happens on the newVM.  I've made a minimal example which I've attached.  It reads each line of the CSV file and checks that ends in 'A' which each row of the CSV file does.  If it doesn't end in 'A' it logs an error.

It repeats this 10 times in case it was an issue with opening and closing streams, but the error happens on the first run anyway.

Note that sometimes things will work fine, and some CSV files work all the time, other times it'll fail.  In this example my device fails the same way every time its run.

On the simulator, on Android and on the old VM this error never occurs.
issues.title: newVM doesn't read input streams the same as the old VM

Add action event to the button as ConnectionRequest request = new ConnectionRequest(); request.setUrl("http://www.google.com"); request.setPost(false); NetworkManager.getInstance().addToQueueAndWait(request); Dialog.show("test", new String(request.getResponseData()), "OK", null); 3. Run on device and press the button What is the expected output? What do you see instead? - Expected to have dialog showed up with HTML contents. - However, the dialog shows up with empty string. After a few tries it hangs and crashes. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? - iPhone 6+, iOS 8.1 - iPhone 4S, iOS 8.1.1 Please provide any additional information below. - By adding "ios.newVM=false", it works perfectly.
issues.title: ConnectionRequest fails with iOS newVM

issues.body: Original [issue 1257](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1257) created by codenameone on 2015-01-05T16:15:41.000Z: This issue relates to the Android platform graphics implementation. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Draw (any) shape with a custom stroke using Graphics.drawShape(). What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected the stroke to be applied, but in reality it is completely ignored. (This is confirmed upon inspection of the source code.) What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Current CN1 released version of libraries (on January 5th 2015). Please provide any additional information below. I need at least the width of the Stroke parameter, but it would be great if you can support all other CN1 Stroke parameters as well. The underlying implementation makes use of the standard Android Paint class, which supports all the properties of the CN1 Stroke object.
issues.title: Graphics.drawShape(Shape, Stroke) ignores the Stroke on Android

setBackDestination("Blah") will trim the entire form stack if "Blah" does not exist. Would be better if this routine checked if "Blah" existed before popping stack.
issues.title: setBackDestination() pops stack even with invalid form name

issues.body:
Original [issue 1239](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1239) created by codenameone on 2014-12-15T07:31:34.000Z:
1. in Netbeans create new CN1 GUI project
2. add 5 forms (GUI 1,...., GUI 5), add a button to each form
3. in the action event for the first 4 forms call showForm(next form)
4. on the last forms postShow setBackDestination Main form
5. in the action event for the button on the last form call back()

If you press the back key (on either Android or iOS skin) on GUI 5, it goes back to GUI 4 and you cannot go back further (so the form stack has been popped as I had shown in a previous post). If you press the button on GUI 5 which calls back(), it goes to Main as expected.

It seems there is a bug in the handling of the form stack and the built-in back behaviour when the form stack is modified.

Same behaviour on actual device.
issues.title: setBackDestination() possible bug

issues.body:
Original [issue 1235](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1235) created by codenameone on 2014-12-01T17:42:21.000Z:

Reason: CN1 recommendation is to avoid using Graphics.drawArc and fillArc since it is specially problematic in iOS and that Shapes should be used instead. The problem is that there is no proper replacement for this, GeneralPath as it is cannot draw an acceptable elliptical arc.

The Arc2D Shape would be enough for my use case, even better would be the ExtendedGeneralPath from Apache Batik that could be used as a base to the existing GeneralPath.
issues.title: RFE: Arc/Elliptical shapes support

issues.body:
Original [issue 1231](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1231) created by codenameone on 2014-11-18T23:48:07.000Z:

As described in summary.

It appears only "GET" and "POST" are shown in the network monitor of the simulator, even if other valid HTTP methods (such as HEAD, PUT, and DELETE) are used.

This was verified using Wireshark on OSX -
Code issues a HEAD request, the simulator's network monitor showed a GET, but verified in Wireshark dump that a HEAD request was in fact issued.

Original [issue 1230](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1230) created by codenameone on 2014-11-18T23:34:13.000Z: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. add component 2. remove it while there is a pending paint in the queue What is the expected output? Remove the component What do you see instead? ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException once in a while What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Latest harder to reproduce in simulator, not so uncommon in real devices. The suggested form.repaint() to workaround this issue in the javadoc is not enough, replace seems to not suffer from this issue.
issues.title: Remove component may trigger ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

Original [issue 1228](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1228) created by codenameone on 2014-11-14T07:25:29.000Z:

In the Windows simulator the text sits on the descent, under the Ubuntu simulator the text starts with the ascender and on IOS the text sits on the baseline.

Original [issue 1225](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1225) created by codenameone on 2014-10-30T10:37:24.000Z:

When using the push messages service, at http://codename-one.appspot.com/sendPushMessage I don't get any acknowledgement that the send was successful.

I do realise that you don't know if the message went all the way though to the device, but at least give me an acknowledgement that I sent all the parameters to you site, it sent the message forward to the Google GCM or the apple service, and that there was no break in communication when sending the certificate or anything like that.

The minimum I need is an OK in the response page when it worked.
The best would be if you could direct me to a page with the parameters needed (sent you one like this before, should work if nothing has changed in the interface).

This is a very important issue(!) since I need to know that the push messages back-end system is working properly, and I can't close the loop without it.

Thank you,
Ram
issues.title: Push messages service does not return acknowledgement of sending

Original [issue 1221](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1221) created by codenameone on 2014-10-29T00:27:00.000Z:

I was wanting to use the OnOffSwitch and found that there was a few issues that I fixed by modifying the original OnOffSwitch.java file from Codenameone. Note that these fixes were for the iOS version of this OnOffSwitch. Attached is the modified file that you can validate and merge in if useful.

The issues fixed are:
1. The background color set in the style for OnOffSwitch was not used
2. The switch could be dragged beyond the place that it should stop which looked odd
3. It was still printing "ON" sometimes when changing the switch even though in noTextMode

Please let me know if you have any questions.
issues.title: Issues in the iOS OnOffSwitch

Original [issue 1219](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1219) created by codenameone on 2014-10-23T16:52:26.000Z: IDE: NetBeans 8.0.1 Desktop OS: Mac OS X I am using ResourceEditorApp to change localization info in res file (XML Team mode). When I "Edit Text" I can insert new lines no problem (by pressing Enter key). And also when I save res file, these new lines are shown in xml file. But if I close ResourceEditorApp, reopen res file and press save again, all the new line chars are changed to space! What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. open ResourceEditorApp (XML Team mode) 2. in Localization press "Edit Text" and create text with new line (press Enter) 3. save res file and close ResourceEditorApp (XML shows text with new line) 4. reopen res file 5. save res file (XML show text with space instead of new line) What is the expected output? What do you see instead? XML file should have not changed after step 5. space char replaced new line char. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Latest on Mac OS X Please provide any additional information below. I believe during opening res file, new line char ($0A) is changed to space ($20). So solution seems to be that new line character needs to be saved as 
 during step 3.
issues.title: in localization new line char is changed to space

issues.body: Original [issue 1201](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1201) created by codenameone on 2014-10-01T16:13:23.000Z: I got a bug with the native Maps component on Android. When a user is handling the map component and suddenly a push message arrives, if I show a Dialog when this push arrives, the Dialog is shown behind the native maps component and you can see the Dialog but through the maps. This only seems to happen when the the user is touching the maps component, when this is not the case it is shown normally. As a result of showing the maps Dialog behind the native maps component, the app is blocked since the Dialog I'm using blocks the GUI until the user hits the OK button, you can still continue to manipulate the map but you can't do anything more since you can't press the OK button and the back button isn't programmed to do anything. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Create a form that uses a Native Maps component. 2.While handling the map, receive a push notification that shows a Dialog 3.The dialog that popped up should appear behind the Native Maps component What is the expected output? What do you see instead? A dialog is shown on top of everything, instead I see a dialog in the back of the native maps component. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Latest version of Codename One, tried this bug on Android but I am not really sure if it could happen on iOS
issues.title: Dialog hidden behind Native maps component

issues.body: Original [issue 1200](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1200) created by codenameone on 2014-10-01T14:27:01.000Z: IPlease clearly state whether the issue relates to a device/the simulator or the tools. iOS devices If related to a device be sure to specify exactly which device with as much details as possible. iPad 2 (iOS ver 8.0.2), iPhone 4 (iOS ver 7.1.2 and iPod Touch running iOS ver 6.1.6) In iPhone port, when you have two TextFields in a form and you click on other textField, the text from the other field is shown briefly. Let me give an example: Form A has two TextFields F1 and F2. When you click on F1 and then click on F2, it briefly shows the text from F1, before showing the text of F2. Also when one of the field is a password field and you enter some text in it and move to another field. Then come back on the first field and try to enter some more letters. In that case it clears the previous inputed values. Also sometimes the field is becoming blank and when you click on other field and then when you click back on the field, it shows the value. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Have a Form with two or more TextFields 2. 3. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The TextFields should not show value or hitText from other fields. The password TextField should retain value when user clicks on it again to enter more chars. The TextField should not become blank when user clicks on other field. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Latest version of Codenameone on Mac OS. Please provide any additional information below. This issue is created as per the discussion on following topic: http://www.codenameone.com/discussion-forum.html?place=topic%2Fcodenameone-discussions%2FobCqt9y8kDs%2Fdiscussion
issues.title: iOS port shows the text or hint text from another TextField on the form

Original [issue 1171](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1171) created by codenameone on 2014-08-24T13:53:47.000Z:

Steps to reproduce:
1. Install app on device
2. Register for push
3. Send push notification with deviceKey=null (to all)
4. One notification is received on device
5. Uninstall app from device
6. Install app on device
7. Register for push
8. Send push notification with deviceKey=null (to all)
9. Two notifications received on device

Does not happen on iOS, because register for push always results in the same key.

See also:
https://groups.google.com/forum/?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer#!topic/codenameone-discussions/XyuYBoyOlXI
issues.title: Multiple push notifications received on Android device after re-registration

issues.body: Original [issue 1170](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1170) created by codenameone on 2014-08-18T23:16:29.000Z: IMPORTANT: This is not a place to ask questions! Please ask questions here: http://www.codenameone.com/discussion-forum.html If you are unsure about an issue go to the discussion forum first. Remove these lines to indicate that you read and understood them. Please clearly state whether the issue relates to a device/the simulator or the tools. If related to a device be sure to specify exactly which device with as much details as possible. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Please first view the video at: http://nisfl.ddns.net/vsc/ShouldNavigate.MOV Within the CN1 BrowserComponent, initiate non-HTML javascript URL Redirect using javascript i.e. window.location.href="sometext"; 2. Use shouldNavigate to catch the non-HTML window.location.href text and process in CN1 3. works fine in Android 4.4.2 and below, all IOS devices and the Simulator 4. In Android 4.4.3 and later, the device html engine briefly displays an error message saying something to the effect of "Web Page Not Found". This only lasts for a second or two, then the CN1 shouldNavigate takes over and the error page disappears. The error message appears whether the text of the window.location.href is valid HTML or not. Even if I've built a valid html page on my server an put the server and page URL in the window.location.href, I still get the same error. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? In Android 4.4.2 and below, the 'Web Page Not Found' error does not appear. The CN1 app code takes the text from the window.location.href and processes it accordingly. The error also does not appear in any (so far) iOS devices. The error also does not appear in the Simulator (Mac OS 1.9.4, java 7 Update 67) What should happen is that the CN1 app shouldNavigate() receives the text from the javascript window.location.href and processes it depending on what the text is (per app code) without getting any error messages. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Error appears on Android 4.4.3 and greater. Please provide any additional information below. The shouldNavigate() DOES do what it is supposed to do in Android 4.4.3 and above. The problem is the brief error message that should not be appearing before the shouldNavigate() takes effect. This happens consistently on a Moto X running Android 4.4.4 and a Nexus 7 running Android 4.4.4. While the Nexus 7 had Android 4.4.3, the same error appeared. When the app was first installed on the Nexus 7, it had Android 4.4.2 and the error message did not appear. Prior to the Moto X upgrading to Android 4.4.4, it was using Android 4.4.2 and never saw that error message. Note that the Google Android page discusses changes in Android 4.4.3 relating to this very situation: https://developer.android.com/guide/webapps/migrating.html Sample javascript used: <script> $(window).scroll(function() { if($(window).scrollTop() + $(window).height() == $(document).height()) { window.location.href="lawtech:www.ag-p.com/last/"; } if($(window).scrollTop() === 0) window.location.href="lawtech:www.ag-p.com/first/"; }); </script> If this can't be fixed, some other way of communicating from javascript back to the BrowserComponent is needed for Android 4.4.3 and above.
issues.title: Android 4.4.3 and greater give 'Web Page Not Found' error in response to javascript shouldNavigate()

issues.body: Original [issue 1169](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1169) created by codenameone on 2014-08-18T11:49:39.000Z: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. build and deploy AppArgBug CN1 application (sources attached) on an Android device 2. open the application - there is a label with AppArg text - will be NULL_VALUE, because the application was not opened by URI scheme 3. open a web page (in firefox, because the newest chrome does not call URI scheme, but the exact application) http://android.alucid.eu/help/q.html and click the PEIG - TEST link -> this will open the AppArgBug application with the AppArg property value in label or only white page - if the first one, continue with 4 4. Minimize the AppArg application with home button (not the back button) 5. Open the AppArg application again from menu What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The screen is either all white, or only Title area is rendered and the rest is all black. The following second scenario: 6. Check the logs What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The AppArg property should be null (because it was not started by URI scheme), but it has still the first value - it is not made null never - even when the Display.getInstance.setProperty("AppArg", null) is called anywhere What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Tested on two devices - Tablet with Android 4.0.4 and a phone with Android 4.1.1 the behaviour was the same. Please provide any additional information below. The URI scheme is alucid://callback - it is registered in codenameone_settings.xml There are two fundamental problems: 1) The AppArg property is sometimes not set and if so it is never nulled then. 2) The application form is not rendered when the application is resumed after it was first opened by URI scheme.
issues.title: URI scheme and AppArg on Android
byte number 8192 is always lost by the socket.read function

Original [issue 1167](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1167) created by codenameone on 2014-08-16T23:33:43.000Z:

I've created certificate/provisioning profiles for IOS Development and Distribution, and configured the CodenameOne plugin in my IDE (Netbeans) accordingly. 

When I use the files for Development, the install packages that are produced on the buildserver include the correct mobileprovision file in Payload/[Appname].app/embedded.mobileprovision, and the install packages can be installed on my test devices without problems.

But when I do the same for Distribution builds, the embedded.mobileprovision file contents in the install packages are wrong. They do not contain the mobileprovision I specified, but instead a mobileprovision from Codename One (see the attached file). I noticed this since I repeatedly failed to upload my binary to iTunes Connect due to "Invalid Provisioning Profile".

I've tried to set invalid certificate passwords and then "Send IOS Appstore build" in order to see if the mobileprovision and certificate files that I provide are even used during the build, and the build server correctly responds with an error indicating the invalid password. I've also tried shorter filenames/directory paths for the dist files. I've also have regenerated all cert/provisioning files a several times following all the available guides, but nothing seems to help.

It would be nice if the build failed instead silently falled back on using a generic Codename One mobileprovision file, if something really is wrong with the cert/provisioning files.
issues.title: AppStore Distribution builds gets the CodenameOne embedded.mobileprovision instead of mine

Create default "Hi World" application. 2. Configure ios.newPipeline=true 3. Build for iOS. 4. Run on non-retina iPad Mini under iOS 7.1.2 What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected to just see "Hi World" form. Instead after a while, the right half of the screen blacks out for a short while and then gets redrawn again. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Current cn1 version with iOS 7.1.2 hardware. Please provide any additional information below. See various experiments in the forum discussion with the same title.
issues.title: New iOS graphics pipeline sometimes flashes right half of screen to black

issues.body: Original [issue 1158](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1158) created by codenameone on 2014-07-18T15:25:01.000Z: If a class uses a constant in an interface and that constant is populated with a call to a method then the code will not build with the new iOS vm. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create interface with static field that invokes a method. 2. Use that constant in implementing class. 3. Compile for iOS with new VM enabled.
issues.title: New VM - build error when static field in interface invokes method

issues.body: Original [issue 1157](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1157) created by codenameone on 2014-07-18T12:24:24.000Z: Relates to iOS device. Android and simulator do not show this behavior. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Form with a webbrowser component not covering the full form. 2. Navigate from a dark form to the form with the webbrowser. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected smooth transition. Instead the area occupied by the webbrowser flashes white before the transition starts. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Latest CN1 libraries (checked!) Device is iPad mini with iOS 7.1.2 Please provide any additional information below. Only the area covered by the webbrowser flashes, hinting that the (native?) browser component is created on-screen.
issues.title: iOS screen flashes while transitioning to screen with web browser component

issues.body: Original [issue 1156](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1156) created by codenameone on 2014-07-18T08:02:55.000Z: This issue relates to the new graphics pipeline implementation on iOS. The issue shows on my (non-retina) iPad Mini, running iOS 7.1.2 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Draw a (orange) colour background. 2. Create a Shape using a GeneralPath. 3. draw the shape in a colour (blue) using the Graphics.fillShape() method. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected to see only the blue Shape on the orange background. However, a white line appears at the "right hand" edge of the Shape. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Up to date library (checked!). Artefact shows on non-retina iPad Mini running iOS 7.1.2 Please provide any additional information below. Android hardware and the simulator do not share the issue. Drawing a blue outline using Graphics.drawShape() does not remove the white line (which suggests it is outside the Shape).
issues.title: Artefact when filling a Shape on iOS using new pipeline.

issues.body:
Original [issue 1154](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1154) created by codenameone on 2014-07-15T20:45:56.000Z:

Currently the Purchase.restore() method provides no way to track the request.  I propose that we add a method restore(ActionListener) to the Purchase class so that we can find out the result of the request.
The ActionListener's actionPerformed method will be passed a subclass of ActionEvent that includes methods to obtain information about the result.

If this sounds fine, let me know, and I can implement it.
issues.title: iOS restore purchases implementation

Found on a Nokia Lukie 620.

The code crashes when the device attempts to resize an image on disk. It occurs when you call ImageIO class save methods and also when you call  Capture.capturePhoto(int width, int height) method which itself uses the ImageIO save methods.

For example, if you create a new codename one project and place in the following code...

String photoPath = Capture.capturePhoto(500, 500);
Dialog.show("Test",  "Path:" + photoPath, "Ok", null); 

The app crashes between accepting the photo and he dialog being shown.

issues.body:
Original [issue 1136](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1136) created by codenameone on 2014-06-09T19:00:02.000Z:

The java.lang.Math class in Java 5 has methods ulp() and nextAfter() to determine units in the last place and adjacent floating point numbers. These are not available in Codename One.

In order to determine ulp. one has to write his own implementation. I have done so, but would like to see support for this in the libraries that come with Codename One (either in the Math class or in the MathUtil class which already fills some of the gaps).

A patch for the MathUtil class is included.

However, there is one other small issue with the current MathUtil class that I have not fixed for fear of breaking someones code: MathUtil.copysign() methods uses incorrect spelling compared to the standard method Math.copySign() (exists since Java 1.6, but with an uppercase s).

I have a bunch of JUnit test cases for this too (all tested against the OpenJDK-version), but I don't know if you use JUnit or some other kind of framework. Please let me know if you want the test cases as well.
issues.title: Support for nextAfter and ulp is missing

Original [issue 1131](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1131) created by codenameone on 2014-05-21T23:42:33.000Z:

I am using the following code to parse a javascript object ...

JSObject   jsObj = (JSObject) ctx.get( data );

... data is a string representation of a large object and I read it from a file.  If the file has a linefeed character in it (hex 0A) the code does not work on an android build on my Nexus 5, Android 4.4.2.  My logs give the following ...

D/esda    (29650): [main] 0:0:5,37 - [ERROR] Uncaught SyntaxError: Unexpected token ILLEGAL On line 1 of

... even if the line character is only the last character in a file.  However, if I run this in the simulator the problem does not happen.  If I strip out all the linefeeds from the file it works fine on Android as well.
issues.title: Unexpected token ILLEGAL parsing javascript object which contains linefeeds.

Original [issue 1126](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1126) created by codenameone on 2014-05-16T16:34:57.000Z:

I try to use the function openOutputStream(file,offset) to open a file in writting at a given offset but it always fails with a "java.io.FileNotFoundException" error.
Whereas if I use the openOutputStream(file) function, all is working well.
The file of course already exists and I call the function with an offset inferior or equals to the length of the file.

I should also say that strangely, the path returned by the getAppHomePath() function is not "/Users/username/.cn1" as it should be, but "file://home" (but if I create a file in the directory returned by getAppHomePath(), it would appear in "/Users/username/.cn1" on my computer. So somehow, "file://home" seems to be an alias to "/Users/username/.cn1" for the simulator). So maybe my problem is linked to this strange behaviour (the alias may not be recognised by the openOutputStream(file,offset) function like it is by the  openOutputStream(file) one?)

I am using the eclipse plugin on a PC with windows 8.1
issues.title: FileSystemStorage.openOutputStream(file,offset) failing in simulator

issues.body: Original [issue 1125](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1125) created by codenameone on 2014-05-13T13:52:58.000Z: When using URI scheme to run an application, the calling uri is passed through AppArg property (Display.getInstance().getProperty("AppArg", null)). However, this property is set only when the application is created and not when it is already in memory and so is (only) resumed. I attach a demo application (the whole CN1 eclipse project without JavaSE) which registers itself to receive URI scheme alucid://callback. When the app is invoked, it writes out the calling url (i.e. calls Display.getInstance().getProperty("AppArg", null)). I also created a demo web site, which generates such URIs: https://android.alucid.eu/help/q.html Unfortunately on android it seems to work, because the browser starts the app as inside itself and when the browser is run again, the testing application is destroyed and created again (so it is not the onResume scenario). You have reproduce it on iOS - the application remains in background there. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Deploy the attached CN1 problem on iOS (iOS7) 2. Open http://android.alucid.eu/help/q.html in a iphone's web browser and click the link. 3. The AppArgBug application opens and writes out the url. 4. Go back to the browser, refresh the page (it generates new uri link) and click the link 5. The application should write different URI, because new was generated, but the old one is written out (because the AppArg was not reset). Another scenario: If you whenever null the AppArg property in the code (Display.getInstance().setProperty("AppArg", null)), then it is removed forever - after being called by URI scheme, empty label is added.
issues.title: AppArg property not updated when app is resumed

issues.body:
Original [issue 1122](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1122) created by codenameone on 2014-05-02T06:53:09.000Z:

Steps:

1) Create a new CodenameOne project in IntelliJ
2) Copy the CN1Sockets.cn1lib file to the /lib folder (get it here: https://github.com/shannah/CN1Sockets/tree/master/dist) 
3) Run the "CodenameOne > Refresh Libraries"
4) Run the "CodenameOne > Run Tests" (explained here: https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1121)
5) Add this line of code to your project:

System.out.println("isSocketSupported = " + Socket.isSocketSupported());

It will print: "isSocketSupported = false"

Current solution: you have to rebuild the javaSE.jar and CodenameOne.jar on your machine and replace them in your project. It seems that the default JARs from codenameone are broken. With the new JARs the code will print "isSocketSupported = true".

I have a Macbook OS X Mavericks with IntelliJ 13.1.2 + Java 1.7u55 + CodenameOne plugin 3.0.8
issues.title: NativeLookup doesn't work with default CodenameOne JAR files (IntelliJ)

issues.body:
Original [issue 1121](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1121) created by codenameone on 2014-05-02T06:45:10.000Z:

If you copy a cn1lib file (e.g. CN1Sockets.cn1lib) into the /lib folder of your IntelliJ project, the native/internal_tmp folder is NOT populated when the project is compiled. That folder remains empty even if you run the "CodenameOne > Refresh Libraries" option in the context menu. This issue prevents you from running the project because the native implementation isn't found. 

Current solution: Click on the "CodenameOne > Run Tests" option in the context menu. After that, the native implementations will be copied into the native subfolders.

I have a Macbook OS X Mavericks with IntelliJ 13.1.2 +  Java 1.7u55 + CodenameOne plugin 3.0.8
issues.title: native/internal_tmp folder is NOT populated with contents of cn1lib (IntelliJ)

issues.body:
Original [issue 1120](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1120) created by codenameone on 2014-05-02T06:35:14.000Z:

Steps to reproduce:
1) Create a new CodenameOne project in IntelliJ (select "hello world" + manual)
2) Double-click on the theme.res file
3) Delete the default theme
4) Create a new "Native Theme" and save the changes
5) Click on the "Native Theme" on the top menu and select "iOS > iOS 7"

If you run the app in the simulator, you will still see the theme of iOS 6. You can choose any native theme (e.g. Gingerbread, nokia, etc.) and you still see the iOS 6 theme when you run the app.

Current solution: you have to rebuild the javaSE.jar and CodenameOne.jar on your machine and replace them in your project. It seems that the default JARs from codenameone are broken.

I have a Macbook OS X Mavericks with IntelliJ 13.1.2 +  Java 1.7u55 + CodenameOne plugin 3.0.8
issues.title: Unable to change native theme on IntelliJ

issues.body:
Original [issue 1108](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1108) created by codenameone on 2014-04-18T01:43:36.000Z:

I use the MathUtil.atan2() function to compute distances between latitude/longitude points on earth (if interested, see here for the different formula: http://www.movable-type.co.uk/scripts/latlong.html) and I found a rather anoying bug as this function sometimes return completely wrong results.
For example MathUtils.atan2(-8.412455031958277E-5,0.5745575809380364) returns -29500.347830595176 whereas the correct value (correctly produced by the J2ME Math.atan2() function) should be -1.464162209488092E-4.
I must say that I only tested it on the simulator (on Eclipse) so I don't know if the results would have been the same on the various mobile platforms.
Could you please investigate the reason of this bug and correct it?
Thanks
issues.title: MathUtil.atn2(x,y) function producing wrong results

issues.body: Original [issue 1107](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1107) created by codenameone on 2014-04-17T19:14:51.000Z: When using the Simulator in the Codename One Designer, a font file located in my project src folder is searched for instead in "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0\jre\bin\src", which doesn't exist and therefore gives the error: ""Error While Running In Simulator: java.lang.RuntimeException: The file wasn't found: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0\jre\bin\src*fontnamehere*". I am unaware if this is only a problem with fonts, but this is where I had the problem. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Place a .ttf in a project's src folder 2. Add a label and set its font to the .ttf font from the file 3. Run the simulator What is the expected output? What do you see instead? I expect for it to look in my project's src folder and find the font, like it does when running the project from Netbeans, but the simulator looks for the src folder in "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0\jre\bin", where the font is not located nor should be located. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Codename One Designer 1.1 (Build number 20140402), Netbeans IDE 8.0, Windows 8.1

It also seems to affect all components, and does not require recursive container structure, or recursive scrolling.

form.setScrollable(true);
for (int i=0;i<50;i++) form.addComponent(new Label(""+i));

Never tested on device.
Freshly installed Java/JDK, presumable latest versions.

issues.body: Original [issue 1096](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1096) created by codenameone on 2014-04-03T12:08:31.000Z: A replace() with a null transition leaves the next component not properly initialized. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create a Container with two Labels in a BoxY layout. 2. Layout the Container. 2. Replace the second Label with a third Label. 3. Check the x, y, width and heigh of the third Label. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected the third Label to have proper coordinates. Instead x,y,width and height are zero. This causes a problem if the next action on the third Label is e.g. an animation. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Today's version. Please provide any additional information below. The documentation of CommonTransitions.createEmpty() states it is the equivalent of replace() with a null parameter. This is not true, if the above is "as designed".

Original [issue 1095](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1095) created by codenameone on 2014-04-03T11:59:27.000Z: The "current" and "next" components appear to not be properly laid out during the fade transition, making this transition useless for containers holding other components. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create Form with a Container containing a Label("Source text"). 2. Perform a replaceAndWait with a CommonTransitions.createFade(500) to another Container containing a Label("Destination text"); 3. Run this code. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected the text in the source container to fade into the destination container text. Instead, the labels inside the containers appear to loose (part of?) their theme settings during the transition. When performing the same transition with a CommonTransitions.createCover(...), this does not happen. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Today's project libraries. (Checked for an update to be sure.) Please provide any additional information below. (None)
issues.title: CommonTransitions.createFade() does not properly support containers.

issues.body: Original [issue 1059](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1059) created by codenameone on 2014-02-10T11:38:54.000Z: Please clearly state whether the issue relates to a device/the simulator or the tools. Actual device as well as on simulator If related to a device be sure to specify exactly which device with as much details as possible. J2ME devices. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create a form with Picker component with Date type. 2. When you click on picker, you will get exception 3. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The picker should show the date picker ui. Instead an out of bounds exception is thrown. java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - java.util.Calendar.get(), bci=98 What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Latest version of the code. Please provide any additional information below. On looking inside the code, the problem is happening due to line number 91 of Picker.java class: ds.setCurrentMonth(cld.get(Calendar.MONTH + 1)); The above line should be changed to: ds.setCurrentMonth(cld.get(Calendar.MONTH)+ 1);

issues.body:
Original [issue 1052](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1052) created by codenameone on 2014-01-25T19:53:00.000Z:

In order to support background fetch in iOS 7 one needs to add the method performFetchWithCompletionHandler in the AppDelegate.m (for reference see http://mobile.tutsplus.com/tutorials/iphone/ios-7-sdk-working-with-background-fetch/ ). 

This is not possible within the current framework.
issues.title: Possibility to modify AppDelegate

issues.body:
Original [issue 1051](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1051) created by codenameone on 2014-01-24T22:26:27.000Z:

Here is a diff of the NativeSources directory of the iOS port against the latest SVN that adds baseline support for Open GL ES2 in iOS.  

The CN1ES2compat.h file includes a #define that allows you to switch between ES1 and ES2 by simply renaming it.

e.g.
# define USE_ES2

enables it
# define _USE_ES2

disables it

This diff includes it disabled by default.

Additional Requirements:

In order to build for ES2 (if you define the USE_ES2 flag), you will need to link the GLKit framework with the project.

Current Status:

I have tested this on the Kitchen Sink app and it appears to work properly except that the "Replace Fade" effect is not smooth for some reason.. Likely the way textures are rendered in the shader needs some tweaking.

Additionally in some cases the responsiveness seems to be a little be slower than using ES1.

I.e. This works, but needs to be refined and optimized.  It can serve, at least, as a baseline for further development.  This diff should not affect performance when building with the ES1 pipeline at all.  It is implemented as a compatibility layer, providing alternate versions of glXXX functions that don't work in ES2.
issues.title: OpenGL ES2 pipeline for iOS

issues.body:
Original [issue 1048](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1048) created by codenameone on 2014-01-21T05:34:22.000Z:

Currently rendering to a buffered image needs to be done on the EDT.  It would be really handy to be able to render images on a background thread so that the UI doesn't lock up while you're rendering something very complex.  

I'm pretty sure that this would be an easy change on iOS and Android.  I don't know about other platforms.  Do you have any strong feelings on this either way?  Are there any road blocks you can think of that I might not be considering?
issues.title: Rendering images in background thread

Original [issue 1018](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1018) created by codenameone on 2014-01-07T12:13:40.000Z:

1) The contacts API doesn't have an Organization field. I have a bunch of contacts on my phone that aren't people that I couldn't do much with because of this.

2) The android implementation seems to be using DISPLAY_NAME for the display name field when I think it should really be using DISPLAY_NAME_PRIMARY for API >= 11. In theory these should be set to the same thing but I think I have some contacts on my phone from third party sources (contact import apps etc) that haven't had all the fields set correctly.
issues.title: Contact API organisation access and android implementation

Run the application on Android emulator (or on an Android device). 3. Navigate from Form1 to Form2. The menu of Form2 now shows a Back command. 4. Navigate from Form2 to Form3, and then back to Form2. 5. The menu of Form2 does not include the Back command anymore. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? At least I would like the behaviour to be consistent across forward and backward navigation. But since Android devices include a dedicated Back button, I would not expect an additional Back button to be added to the menu at all. (This also potentially implies a L10N issue, as the menu item should be in the right language.) What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? CodenameOne 1.1 Designer Build 20131224 on Windows 8.1. Please provide any additional information below. (None)

Original [issue 1010](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1010) created by codenameone on 2013-12-25T09:48:06.000Z:

When making a ConnectionRequest to a website that is using both Set-cookie and Set-Cookie, not all cookies are set. 

For example when connecting to https://stadssb.au.dk/sb_STAP/sb/common/velkommen.jsp the headers are 
Set-cookie: [cookieEnabled=yTY0S5HQm6Mfx7xbFgVk3CLn00Xsq7BLnTdgJ4J6JdvH1Vpq9sSn!1366560686!1387890560067]
Set-Cookie: [selvbetjening=yTY0S5HQm6Mfx7xbFgVk3CLn00Xsq7BLnTdgJ4J6JdvH1Vpq9sSn!1366560686; path=/; HttpOnly]

but only the Set-Cookie par is sent with the following request. 

I'm using the IntelliJ IDEA version from the 23/12-2013 on Windows 8. It is tested with the simulator. 

The thing to change is probably line 329 in ConnectionRequest.java it states
String[] cookies = impl.getHeaderFields("Set-Cookie", connection);

Either this should be case insensitive or multiple requests should be performed.
issues.title: Multiple cookie headers with different casing is not recognized
