issues.body:
Original [issue 1007](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1007) created by codenameone on 2013-12-21T20:29:38.000Z:

Occurs in simulator & on devices

Forum thread https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/codenameone-discussions/2MrJyca1raU

I found the issue is here in the addCommand(Command, index) method in SideMenuBar.class

```
    if (getBackCommand() != null
            && getCommandCount() > 0
            && !UIManager.getInstance().isThemeConstant("hideBackCommandBool", false)
            && !getCommands().contains(getBackCommand())) {
        getCommands().insertElementAt(getBackCommand(), 0);
    }
```

The first time this is called the back command isn't in the commands list so it gets inserted at position 0 which is incorrect for the side menu since the commands are subsequently iterated in reverse order.

On subsequent calls to this method the back command is already in the commands list so it ends up at the end of the list and the order of commands displayed in the side menu is then correct.

Have worked around it for now by doing a dummy add/remove command sequence before adding the required commands.

Would suggest that the insertion of the back command be down at the end of the commands list.

Original [issue 962](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=962) created by codenameone on 2013-11-20T21:13:57.000Z:

IOS Thread started with Thread.createThread; & start() are not being cleaned after they have finished.

My app was creating a spin off thread with a runnable to run a task, thread creation looked like this

Thread T = thread.create(someRunnable, some Name);
T.start();

Then in run() the  runnable would do its thing, and then exit the run() method.

On my regular iOS app, after an non-determinant amount of time, the program would crash.  With an Xcode 5 build run under the Debugger (phone was ios7 os), I found three different crash points:

First happened in java_lang_ThreadGroup.m, in the remove__java_lang_Thread() method. This is displayed in screen shot ThreadGroup1.png and Thread Group3.png (I trapped it twice).

Second happened in java_lang_ThreadGroup.m, in java_lang_ThreadGroup_add___java_lang_Thread
as shown in ThreadGroup2.png

The third was a system exit that would occur with an message “too many processes” and giving an exit code of 35. 

Th third one intrigued me so I wrote a test program that would create a thread which would do a small operation, sleep for a specified time, and then die. A new thread would then be created to do the same thing. 

On the ios build, the program would die with the created count at 1070. This was regardless of the delay time entered. To put it in perspective, I stopped the Android version of the test when it reached 500,000 threads created.

Attached is the source for that test. Enter the pause time between threads in the text field then press the “Suicide” button the start the test. Should exit around 1070 on iOS.

I am sorry I did not have the time to look deeper into the cause of this. I have worked around this issue by creating my own thread pool and using that.
issues.title: IOS Thread started with Thread.createThread; & start() are not being cleaned after they have finished + ThreadGroup issues.
Crash Report not working on device, only in simulator

Original [issue 926](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=926) created by codenameone on 2013-10-22T11:35:28.000Z:

This is the code I use to repeat the crash on calling sequential createMedia and Media play calls on iOS.  I use the URI version of the call for loading the file.

I have built a simple test App with 2 forms, which recreate the crash issue I was seeing in my full app.
The first form, managed by a UITimer, does the following:
 
 
1.  calls create media to load the sound
2.  plays the sound (about 1 second or so of audio)
3.  and the Runnable calls 
                   if(media_.isPlaying())
                              media_.pause();
                  media_.cleanup();
                  media_ = null;
 
4. The timer waits for the Runnable to signal completion
5. Then the whole process repeats by calling create media again

 
On an Android build of this test, I have let it run for over an hour with no issues. On the iOS build, it usually does not last more than 4-5 minutes before the sound stops playing without any manual direction. No sounds are ever heard again. This does not cause the app to crash right away, but text manipulation in a label does! After the sound has stopped, I go to a second form which has a text field. When I focus the textfield for editing, and the app would immediately disappear (crash). I suspect if I changed the text of a label, it would crash as well.

So testing steps are:

Press Suicide Button on first form so sound is playing continuously.
Sound should stop playing on its own (within 5 minutes on my phone).
Press Second button to go to second form.
Click on text field to go boom.

code src directory from basic eclipse project attached.

Thanks so much.
issues.title: iOS crash with sounds playing

issues.body:
Original [issue 925](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=925) created by codenameone on 2013-10-21T14:55:21.000Z:

Filing this as Eric requested on the Forum.

Simple code snippet that creates a Result object from an XML string below:

   String xml =  "<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>" + 
       "<root>" + 
       "<Device><Name>Nexus 7</Name><Manufacturer>Asus</Manufacturer></Device>" +
       "<Device><Name>Nexus 4</Name><Manufacturer>Asus</Manufacturer></Device>" +
       "<Device><Name>HTC ONE S</Name><Manufacturer>HTC</Manufacturer></Device>" +
       "<Device><Name>HTC Butterfly</Name><Manufacturer>HTC</Manufacturer></Device>" +
       "<Device><Name>HTC Butterfly S</Name><Manufacturer>HTC</Manufacturer></Device>" +
       "</root>";

   Result result = Result.fromContent(xml, Result.XML);

Now, let's try to get all Device Names that have Manufacturer 'HTC'.
The expression for this would be:
String[] namesArray = result.getAsStringArray("//Device[Manufacturer='HTC']/Name");

But this only returns one Name (the first one it finds in the xml that has Manufacturer HTC).

Original [issue 922](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=922) created by codenameone on 2013-10-17T20:15:14.000Z:

If I call Display.getInstance().execute("http://www.google.com"); for example, on the simulator, iOS and Android it'll open the native browser.  

On windows phone 8 it says you need an app to complete this action, opens the windows store and says no app is available.

Expected behaviour:

Open the native browser on the phone with the URL specified - in line with the other platforms.
issues.title: Display execute doesn't load browser on Windows Phone 8

issues.body: Original [issue 921](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=921) created by codenameone on 2013-10-17T15:20:01.000Z: Please clearly state whether the issue relates to a device/the simulator or the tools. Real Device If related to a device be sure to specify exactly which device with as much details as possible. Blackberry RIM device 8520 with OS 5.0 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Send a push message like "Hello Sample Push" to device 2. 3. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The push message is shown in duplicate on the device along with extra text of "Cache-Control: max-age=3600" Instead showing the push message as below: "Hello Sample Push" the following push message is shown: "Hello Sample Push Cache-Control: max-age=3600 Hello Sample Push" As you can see, the push message "Hello Sample Push" is twice and has extra text of "Cache-Control: max-age=3600" What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? SVN version 1495. Please provide any additional information below. This is only happening in RIM devices, on Android and IPhone the correct push message is shown. For your information the cn1 and device push Id are given below: CN1 Push Device Id : 19156170 and native Push Device Id : 274529cd And the push is sent from server with type=1 and prod=true.
issues.title: Blackberry Push message is showing extra data - 'Cache-Control: max-age=3600"

issues.body: Original [issue 917](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=917) created by codenameone on 2013-10-15T07:57:30.000Z: Please clearly state whether the issue relates to a device/the simulator or the tools. If related to a device be sure to specify exactly which device with as much details as possible. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create an app with textfield and run it on Android 4.3 2. Open textfield for editing and close the keyboard, repeat many times. At some random time App is closed with fatal error. It helps to get error faster by using complex widgets, for example add also a MapComponent. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Fatal error with the following log: 10:36:12.515 14155 my.testapp ERROR IMGSRV :0: gralloc_unregister_buffer: Cannot unregister a locked buffer (ID=50196) 10:36:12.515 14155 my.testapp WARN GraphicBufferMapper unregisterBuffer(0x58f8e6e8) failed -22 (Invalid argument) 10:36:12.530 14155 my.testapp ERROR Surface Surface::unlockAndPost failed, no locked buffer 10:36:12.530 14155 my.testapp WARN System.err java.lang.IllegalArgumentException 10:36:12.538 14155 my.testapp WARN System.err at android.view.Surface.nativeUnlockCanvasAndPost(Native Method) 10:36:12.538 14155 my.testapp WARN System.err at android.view.Surface.unlockCanvasAndPost(Surface.java:255) 10:36:12.538 14155 my.testapp WARN System.err at android.view.SurfaceView$4.unlockCanvasAndPost(SurfaceView.java:844) 10:36:12.538 14155 my.testapp WARN System.err at com.codename1.impl.android.AndroidView.flushGraphics(AndroidView.java:269) 10:36:12.538 14155 my.testapp WARN System.err at com.codename1.impl.android.AndroidImplementation.flushGraphics(AndroidImplementation.java:706) 10:36:12.538 14155 my.testapp WARN System.err at com.codename1.impl.CodenameOneImplementation.paintDirty(CodenameOneImplementation.java:389) 10:36:12.538 14155 my.testapp WARN System.err at com.codename1.ui.Display.edtLoopImpl(Display.java:974) 10:36:12.538 14155 my.testapp WARN System.err at com.codename1.ui.Display.mainEDTLoop(Display.java:899) 10:36:12.546 14155 my.testapp WARN System.err at com.codename1.ui.RunnableWrapper.run(RunnableWrapper.java:119) 10:36:12.546 14155 my.testapp WARN System.err at com.codename1.impl.CodenameOneThread$1.run(CodenameOneThread.java:60) 10:36:12.546 14155 my.testapp WARN System.err at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:841) What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Latest CN1 buildserver build, Android 4.3 Samsung Galaxy Nexus Please provide any additional information below. The problem seams to come from the following Android 4.3 bug: https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=58385 The problem is that you should ensure that changes to the surface size and format happen outside lockCanvas() / unlockCanvas(), but it seams difficult because size is changed due to keyboard hide therefore only suggested work-around seams to be to replace SurfaceView with a regular View.
issues.title: Keyboard hide sometimes crashes on Android 4.3

Original [issue 916](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=916) created by codenameone on 2013-10-15T06:47:52.000Z:

I installed the Kitchen Sink on some Android models, and as I expected is not fully multiscreen, on a Samsung Galaxy Tab2 with Android 4.1.2.

Problem:

Icons and Button Screen are on the same screen (activity). When I click on all of the buttons,The botton part slides and change, but not the whole activity.

Auto Scale

Original [issue 908](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=908) created by codenameone on 2013-10-01T14:29:41.000Z:

GZConnectionRequest does not work in Windows Phone 8, the same code works in all other platforms, please notice that:

1- setting the header using addRequestHeader("Accept-Encoding", "gzip, deflate") does work (so it is not related to issue 794, btw ConnectionRequest does work here)

2- reading the response headers does work, so the request was completed, it fails when reading the response body.

It is probably an issue with the GZIPInputStream in Windows Phone 8
issues.title: GZConnectionRequest does not work in Windows Phone 8

Original [issue 906](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=906) created by codenameone on 2013-09-30T19:03:14.000Z:

I am getting several reports of this from users who have converted to iOS 7.

My app lets a user capture barcodes for use later. They hit my Scan button, the camera opens, the barcode is scanned, and they are back in my app. They do this 3 or 4 times and the app hangs on scan, the camera never appears.

This seems to be a problem with ZBar under iOS 7, other developers are reporting it. ZBar thread: http://sourceforge.net/p/zbar/discussion/1072195/thread/df4c215a/?limit=50

More from stackoverflow: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/19019607/zbar-sdk-and-ios7-xcode-5-app-is-reaching-100-cpu-use-and-memory-more-than-10
issues.title: Barcode scanning locks up under iOS 7

issues.body: Original [issue 905](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=905) created by codenameone on 2013-09-30T10:53:50.000Z: I have written a simple login dialog code, for this I consumed the Java SE business logic that validates the user credentials. The code is in attachment. I redesigned the UI for mobiles using codename One GUI builder. The code is working fine for iOS and Android devices. But, when I deployed the xap file on windows 8 phone (that also uses the same code used for iOS and Android application creation), the Ui is not taking any user entered data and it is giving exceptions. I can only view the UI. the text feild data is not taking properly. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Use the program in attachment and deploy it on windows 8 phone. 2.enter the password, click on login button 3.Java null pointer exception will appear on UI What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The password should validate in business logic and the result of validation should be displayed What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Latest version of codename one Netbeans 7.3.1 IDE windows 8 phone with windows 8 SDK Please provide any additional information below. Some time the JavaBusinessModule access error might also appear
issues.title: Text feild entry is not working for windows 8 phone

issues.body: Original [issue 903](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=903) created by codenameone on 2013-09-30T06:01:07.000Z: When we tried to upload the application to Windows Phone Store, the application was rejected due to: "The application's 'pin to start' icon is a generic Windows Phone icon". What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Use default or custom application icon. 2. Send Windows Phone build (WP8). 3. Send the xap to Windows Phone Store. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Application accepted for publishing by Microsoft. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? It does not matter. Please provide any additional information below. Without a fix, no application can be published in Store. So this is an urgent issue.

java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space

issues.body:
Original [issue 899](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=899) created by codenameone on 2013-09-24T15:26:15.000Z:

Issue posted per discussion thread.

This is on an android 2.3 platform:

I have discovered my app is creating a bunch of files on the disk, all with the name 

mtmp-<some unique number>dat

Upon close examination of these files, I have found they are copies of the sound files from my app. I have also found that one appears to be created each time I load and play a sound. These files are not being cleaned up, so eventually the disk gets full. It is very possible I am doing something wrong.

My procedure for loading a sound is pretty standard, 

final Input is = Display.getInstance().getResourceAsStream(SoundPlay.class, fname_);

media_ = MediaManager.createMedia(is, mime_, EndRunnable);

 ...and sometime later...

media_.play();

My EndRunnable is reloading the sound file, though not playing it yet

An explicit call of media_cleanup() in the EndRunnable after playing does remove the file.
issues.title: sound files being left behind after media is played

issues.body: Original [issue 884](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=884) created by codenameone on 2013-09-15T09:44:34.000Z: This always happens using the Designer and simulator - its 100% reproducible, and happens every time i use the designer. (don't know if it happens on real devices, always fix it with manual work-arounds in simulator first.) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Add a button or other component to a form 2. give it a new UIID 3. edit that style, e.g. give it a different alignment or padding which moves its position 3. Run in simulator. 4. A this point, the unselected button has the correct style, but if you press it or select it, you get no style so it "moves". (which is correct behavior) 5. Goto the style (i.e. UIID) in the theme (only have one theme: Default). 6. Right click and select Derive All. 7. Now it creates copies of your style under Selected,Pressed and Disabled. 8. Save the Design. 9. Rebuild the app. 10. Run the simulator. 11. You see the same problem as before, i.e. the selected and pressed styles are missing and the button behaves as though those states styles did not exist. 12. Go back to the designer and check the pressed and selected styles are there - they are and they correctly derive from the unselected style, they are just "invisible" to the app when running. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Win 7 Pro 64bit. Designer v 1.1 Please provide any additional information below. Workaround: This problem is made significantly worse by the fact that if you delete one of the other states bad styles, it also deletes your "master" unselected states style. So if you want to fix the issue, it is more work. The answer seems to be to not derive styels, but to copy and paste the style into each state. This is more work to edit later, but seems to work.
issues.title: [BUG] Derive All does not work.

issues.body:
Original [issue 883](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=883) created by codenameone on 2013-09-15T09:11:31.000Z:

In the Designer, if you add a command to a button, and set the name to nothing, the icon to X, the pressed icon to Y and action to some form, then save, it works.

But then you want to change the pressed down icon.  If you open the command dialog for that button again, change the pressed icon, and hit save, it looks like it worked.

But then the pressed icon has not changed, its still the old one. 

It is not possible to change the pressed icon.

The workaround I was using was to delete the whole button and start again, which is time consuming. I have found a better work around - if you change the pressed icon, then also change the name of the command, then hit save, it saves the pressed down icon. Then you can edit the command again and change the name back.
issues.title: [BUG] when you change the Pressed Icon and save, it doesn't save the change.

issues.body:
Original [issue 882](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=882) created by codenameone on 2013-09-12T20:56:28.000Z:

We work in a team environment so we started using the new Theme.xml way when working on theme file. 
XML way seemed like a great idea at first, but we are having major issues with conflicts while merging. 

My guess is because of the way XML document gets generated each time, it shifts the orders and inserts so this throws git and other diff tools out whack. There is 100s of conflicts all over place and its really hard to hunt down which change goes where. It takes longer just to fix the conflicts then it is to recreate the theme elements by hand. 
I don't know if something can be done to the xml so that new elements are maybe always on the bottom so this way minimizes the randomness ?

It was suggested by Shai Almog that ordering the serialized data before its outputed to xml might solve the issue

Thanks
issues.title: Theme.XML ordering and git merging conflicts

Original [issue 863](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=863) created by codenameone on 2013-09-04T21:21:08.000Z:

On an iPad:

Display.getInstance().lockOrientation(true)

Locks the screen in Portrait mode.  
However it does not actually switch the screen to portrait (or landscape) mode.

Also, I would suggest switching lock orientation from a true/false to words:

Display.getInstance().lockOrientation(Display.PORTRAIT);

The way it is currently written, it could (and was) assumed that locking the orientation was done by passing true, unlocking was false.

public static final boolean PORTRAIT=true;
public static final boolean LANDSCAPE=false;

or (switch to int and) use the Java values:

java.awt.print.PageFormat

public static final int LANDSCAPE=0
public static final int PORTRAIT=1
public static final int REVERSE_LANDSCAPE=2
issues.title: RFE Orientation Lock

issues.body:
Original [issue 861](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=861) created by codenameone on 2013-09-04T18:59:00.000Z:

Currently the "Generate Native Access" option for generating native interfaces does not generate a JavaSE stub, nor is a JavaSE stub supported even if added manually.  When developing native libraries that are intended to work cross platform, it would be very helpful to be able to generate native stubs that will work on JavaSE as well (i.e. in the simulator) so that the library's functionality won't be crippled when running inside the simulator.

There doesn't appear to be a feasible workaround for this either.

I'm happy to try to solve this problem myself and contribute the fix, but I think this fix involves modifications to the build server so I don't think I'm able to.

As I know you are busy, I understand that this may take a long time to be completed.  In the mean time, even deciding the prefix that will be used for the native stubs would be helpful so that I can implement this in the offline build tools and be sure that it will be compatible with the eventual official implementation.

I propose making the prefix "javase" all lowercase without the quotes.
(By prefix, I mean the name of the folder inside the "native" directory that contains the Java SE packages).
issues.title: JavaSE Native Access

Original [issue 828](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=828) created by codenameone on 2013-08-07T21:21:58.000Z:

On Windows Phone 8 the Microsoft.Phone.Controls.WebBrowser defaults to false for javascript.  There isn't a property to enable it so the Windows Phone 8 browser component is unable to function the same was as other platforms.

The relevant docs from Microsoft:

Public property IsScriptEnabled Enables or disables scripting. This applies to the next document that is navigated to, not the current document. This property is false by default. Set this property to true to enable scripting, or false to disable scripting.

I'd suggest that Scripts should be enabled by default as you are contructing a WebBrowser to point to a specific page and if that page has scripts on it it seems more likely than not that the expected behaviour would be that the scripts are executed.
issues.title: Windows Phone 8 Browser Component doesn't enable Javascript

Original [issue 813](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=813) created by codenameone on 2013-07-30T19:05:49.000Z:

I notice that the Javascript library has been added to the core.  I have just added some cleanup functionality to be able to free Javascript object references that are no longer needed.  Previously any Javascript object that is wrapped by a JSObject java object has a reference stored in a global lookup table array (in the Javascript runtime).  This array lives until the browser page is reloaded, or the browser component is destroyed.  For most small cases this isn't an issue, but if complex components are created that are long-lived, it could accumulate a lot of Javascript objects in this array.

I have added a sort of automatic reference counting mechanism now to be able to clean up stale references so that the Javascript GC can free them.  The Git diff for this change is at:
https://github.com/shannah/CodenameOneJS/commit/fbf8770ed2061dae3b4b4c90d32e449206e74f55

I haven't had a chance to take a look at the refactored version in the core yet.  Is this Git diff sufficient for you to apply the changes, or would you like me to make changes to the com.codename1.javascript package in the CN1 repo and submit that diff?

Note:  I haven't run into any memory problems yet, and I've used some complex components that live a pretty long time, but this was just bugging me since theoretically this array would just keep growing until the browsercomponent is destroyed or reloaded.

Steve
issues.title: Javascript Library JS Memory leaks

issues.body:
Original [issue 809](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=809) created by codenameone on 2013-07-29T20:37:10.000Z:

It is well known (Shai reminds us often) that you can't embed resources in a directory structure in your app because on iOS (and possibly Windows Phone) all resources are just copied flat in to the top directory of the app bundle.

It doesn't need to be this way.  For my offline builds of iOS I have been using full resource path structures for quite some time... I just updated my offline build project to do this too.  I do it by not letting XMLVM deal with the resources at all.  Instead I add a runscript build phase to the Xcode project that copies the resources into the bundle during the Xcode build step, maintaining the directory structure.

Relevant portions of my offline build script are as follows:
1. Copy all resources from the class path into a resources directory.
      <copy todir="${xcoderes.path}">
          <fileset dir="src" excludes="**/*.java"/>
          <fileset dir="lib/impl/cls" excludes="**/*.java"/>
      </copy>
2. Do the XMLVM build normally.
3. Add the runscript build phase to the xcode project:
       <exec executable="/usr/bin/php" dir="${buildscripts.path}">
          <arg file="${xcodeadd.path}"/>
          <arg file="${xcodeproj.path}/project.pbxproj"/>
      </exec>

The ${xcodeadd.path} variable refers to a PHP script that actually does the processing of the xcode project and adds the runscript.  I have attached the script for reference.  Ultimately it just adds the following 1-line runscript:

cp -r "${PROJECT_DIR}/../resources/" "${BUILT_PRODUCTS_DIR}"

Justification for this change:
1. One of the strengths of Java is its namespace ability.  Without the ability to also include complementary resources for Java libraries it limits the potential of third-party libraries.
2. Specific case is for libraries that wrap BrowserComponents and provide HTML-based components.  We need to be able to embed stylesheets, images, html files, and Javascript files - or if "need" is too strong a word, it is much nicer to be able to embed these things without having to encode them into a Java class.
3. Eliminate possibility of conflicts.  WIth third party libraries, even if they just use a flat directory structure, there is potential for conflicts if two libraries use resources with the same name.

Possible Pitfalls:
1. Optimization and Obfuscation.  Currently unused java classes and methods are stripped out of the resulting binaries which helps to keep the binary size to a minimum.  Resources don't naturally conform to this type of optimization so if the CN1 core gets bloated with lots of resources, it will result in the application binaries growing larger whether or not the additional resources are used.
   
     Solutions:  
         a. Don't use resources in the CN1 core.  They are still very useful for external libraries.  That way application developers can opt to use the library only if they need it.  Thereby not bloating their application with unneeded resources.
        b. Require CN1 classes to declare which resource directory trees they depend on using either an annotation or some other method.  Then use s proguard (or similar) as a preprocessing step to strip out resources which are not needed.
   
   ```
    (I think solution a is perfectly fine and it doesn't require any special development).
   ```
2. Consistency across platforms.  If we make this change to iOS, then what about Windows Phone, Blackberry, J2ME, and Android?  
       Solution:
         I would propose that all platforms should retain directory structure of resources.  Android already does.  I haven't tried Windows Phone but I'm sure a similar solution to the iOS solution would not be difficult to create.  I presume since JME and Blackberry are built on Java that they already retain directory structure of resources.
3. Backward compatibility:  What if current apps depend on the flat directory structure?
      Solutions:
         a. Add a built flag to make this optional.
         b. Deprecate the old behavior and ask people to change it.  I doubt many people depend on this behavior, and if they do, they are probably placing their resources in the root anyways, which would still function the same way.

This one change will drastically increase the potential for a third-party library eco system.

References:
1. The offline build tools projects build file.  (It's a mess, but you can refer to the "build-for-ios-device-locally" target to see the IOS build rules:
http://codenameone-incubator.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/shannah/offline-build-tools/templates/build-ios.xml
1. PHP Script for adding runscript build phase to Xcode Project:
   http://codenameone-incubator.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/shannah/offline-build-tools/scripts/prepare_xcode_project.php

Steve
issues.title: RFE: Resources directory structure

issues.body: Original [issue 808](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=808) created by codenameone on 2013-07-29T19:12:35.000Z: When setting a newly created UIID as the DialogUIID of a LoginDialog, the rest of the standard dialogs appear without a border or color inside (look at screenshot) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create a new LoginDialog Gui Element on the Gui Designer 2. issues.body:
Original [issue 782](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=782) created by codenameone on 2013-07-15T07:35:34.000Z:

Hi.

Sidebar menu switches show() and showBack() transitions of the related application form as follows:

1) The starting point is a form with, say, a Button/MultiButton to activate a new form. The new form has a back command to showBack() the original application form. The application form also contains sidebar type of commands.

2) If the sidebar menu is opened (by pressing the hamburger icon) and closed without activating any command (again by pressing the hamburger icon) the application form is shown normally. How ever, when the button is pressed, the new form activates with showBack() transition and closes with show() transition - so the transitions are kind of switched.

3) If the button is pressed again, the transitions work normally again.

All the best,
Jarkka Reunanen
issues.title: Sidebar menu causes transition side effects

Original [issue 761](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=761) created by codenameone on 2013-06-22T11:26:21.000Z:

Hi,

I discovered, that an instance for a MP3 uri of the Media interface, created by Display.getInstance().createMedia(), does not keep the time when I hit Media.pause().

If I let it play for a view seconds, hit Media.pause() and resume it using Media.play() it always starts off from 0sec. I have to keep track of the time and set it using Media.setTime() after calling Media.play()

I would like to see, that instances of Media always resume where I paused. I can set the time to 0 if I want.

FYI: I also discovered that Media.getTime() returns 0, when it's paused. Maybe it has something to do with that?

Pause is not Stop ;)
issues.title: Audio implementation for Media interface doesn't keep the time when pause

issues.body:
Original [issue 760](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=760) created by codenameone on 2013-06-22T10:48:12.000Z:

Hi, all

As written in # 759, I have a MediaPlayer class, where all media, playing there, is located on an external server. When I create a new Media instance of them and start the play() function, the instance starts fetching data from the server.

The documentation for the Interface Media says the following about the methods getDuration() and getTime():

```
/**
 * Returns the time in seconds in the audio file or -1 if not known
 *
 * @return time in milli seconds
 */
public int getTime();

/**
 * Returns the length in seconds of the audio file or -1 if not known
 *
 * @return time in milli seconds
 */
public int getDuration();
```

But all my instances return the integer 0 if I call getDuration() during buffering of the first bytes - before I hear a sound. Shouldn't this be -1?
The same applies to getTime() ... but there I can understand it, because the player hasn't started playing - therefore 0sec.

Can you please change the value of getDuration() to -1 when the element is buffering? Otherwise I have to rely on that the duration is 0 while the metadata of the mp3 file is fetched and evaluated.

This is only tested on the simulator. On Android it at least doesn't return -1, otherwise it wouldn't call Media.isPlaying() - see # 759 for more information about my implementation.

I wasn't able to test it on iOS due to # 755 ...
issues.title: Media.getDuration() returning 0 instead of -1 when instance reads mp3 metadata

Original [issue 695](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=695) created by codenameone on 2013-05-03T15:51:04.000Z:

From the Apple iOS Human Interface Guidelines:

Make sure your UI can handle the double-high status bar. The double-high status bar appears during events such as in-progress phone calls, audio recording, and tethering. In unprepared apps the extra height of this bar can cause layout problems. For example, the UI can become pushed down or covered.

One of my users reported that the UI becomes pushed down, and my layout is messed up. I draw graphics on top of a form, and the graphics are not pushed down by the same distance as the rest of the form. Also the UI did not respond to user input, maybe because of this.

There doesn't seem to be support for this.

Also, can the functionality to test the double-high status bar be added to the simulator?
issues.title: Double-high status bar support on iOS

issues.body:
Original [issue 692](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=692) created by codenameone on 2013-05-03T11:12:33.000Z:

There are numerous issues surrounding rendering after cancelling out of photo/barcode/QR code capture on iOS devices.

Tested this on an iPhone4:
1. Launch the Kitchen Sink demo.
2. Select "Camera".
3. Select "Capture".
4. Press "Cancel". On returning to the main app you get a completely black screen, apart from the "Capture" button.
5. Rotate the screen. App recovers.

Seen on an iPhone4 and an iPod Touch 4th gen:
1. Display a Form.
2. Launch a dialog with a button to initiate barcode capture.
3. In the button's actionPerformed(...), do "dialog.dispose(); CodeScanner.getInstance().scanQRCode(...);"
4. On the barcode scan screen, rotate the phone from portrait to lanscape (or vice versa).
5. Press "Cancel". On returning to the form, the entire screen is stretched/squashed. See "ios after scan.png" for an example.
6. Rotate the screen TWICE. App recovers.
issues.title: iOS rendering issues after photo/barcode capture

Original [issue 688](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=688) created by codenameone on 2013-05-02T11:20:15.000Z:

If a single-line TextField is not wide enough to display all the text it contains, there are some clipping issues.

If the text is manually entered, the clipping on the left hand side is too far over to the left. It appears it isn't taking the width of one or both of the borders into account when calculating the clip width.

If the text is entered using TextField.setText(...) then the clipping appears to be too far to the right. I think this is because in this case you see the start of the truncated text, not the end.

I've attached a couple of screenshots which highlight the issue - a couple from the simulator, and one from an iPad. I've only seen this on iOS since the default styles on the other platforms don't include left/right borders.

This doesn't appear to be an issue with multi-line TextFields since the text gets wrapped to fit.
issues.title: TextField rendering issue

I found that it could be fixed in the Themes view by adding "Tabs" and "TabContainer" and then for both going to the colour tab, turning off the "Derive Transparency" checkbox and making sure the transparency is set to 0.

If this could be fixed up so that a workaround isn't needed it might prevent others from needing to work out why their tabs look so bad in Android Holo theme

Thanks
issues.title: Tabs and TabContainer have the wrong background color in Android Holo theme

issues.body:
Original [issue 674](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=674) created by codenameone on 2013-04-24T10:49:42.000Z:

In the ResponseCallback() method in SilverlightImplementation.cs, there is an unhandled WebException thrown from 

resp = (HttpWebResponse).request.EndGetResponse(asyncResult);

This leads to the console message:

An exception of type 'System.Net.WebException' occurred in System.Windows.ni.dll and wasn't handled before a managed/native boundary

In the case where the error is from the server, it is possible to retrieve the original response from the exception:

resp = (HttpWebResponse)e.Response;

However in cases where the server did not respond, the response will be null, which will require extra handling.
issues.title: Silverlight implementation: More complete handling needed for network errors

Original [issue 646](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=646) created by codenameone on 2013-04-11T07:08:23.000Z:

Here's my situation:
I create a request to a server and depending on if I'm logged in or not, I get a 200 or a 401 response.
In the simulator all goes fine. I create a derive of the ConnectionRequest class and pass it to the NetworkManager and the method readResponse() is fired on 200 and the method handleErrorResponseCode() in 401.

Strange now is, that if I execute the same code on my android-device, I get the exception like described here: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1357372/ioexception-received-authentication-challenge-is-null-apache-harmony-android

The only way to get this is by listening for an error using addErrorListener() on the NetworkManager ... But I don't want to do that. This way I have absolutely no control which request triggered the error and I have no idea if this would also work on iOS devices. And maybe I run into other problems having multiple connections in the network-cue.
issues.title: Recieving a 401-Response has different effect on Android and the simulator

issues.body:
Original [issue 644](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=644) created by codenameone on 2013-04-10T21:56:30.000Z:

I have been trying for a couple of days to produce test code for this but it always works. Yet my app consistently crashes. It seems that CodenameOne is recursively firing action events until it crashes. Works on Android and simulator

I have a form with a ComboBox, a TextField and a Button. When the form is displayed, the keyboard is displayed automatically. The ComboBox is used to change the selection criteria, the keyboard collapses when you touch the ComboBox. After the user makes a selection the keyboard is redisplayed automatically. This seems to be the key. If I don't redisplay the keyboard after the ComboBox selection and the user touches the input field to bring it back, everything works.

If user brings up the form, types some input touches my button it works.

If the user brings up the form, changes the ComboBox selection, enters some text touches my button it crashes. The button actionPerformed is never called.

If the user brings up the form, makes a ComboBox selection, enters some text, then clicks Done in the keyboard, it works.

I ran it under XCode and there was a long stack trace that seems to show recursive firing of events, my code does seem to be involved. I have attached the stack trace. Hopefully that will shed some light on the problem.
issues.title: iOS crash touching button while keyboard displayed.

issues.body:
Original [issue 641](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=641) created by codenameone on 2013-04-09T03:20:46.000Z:

This problem occurred on a Samsung Android tablet.

Since it happened to a customer of ours I don't really know any details.  However, I did get a stack trace though:

Error: java.lang.NullPointerException From: 
at com.codename1.ui.TextArea.getLines()
at com.codename1.ui.plaf.DefaultLookAndFeel.getTextAreaSize()
at com.codename1.ui.TextArea.calcScrollSize()
at com.codename1.ui.Component.getScrollDimension()
at com.codename1.ui.TextArea.isScrollableY()
at com.codename1.ui.Component.isScrollable()
...
many more lines
...
at com.codename1.impl.android.InPlaceEditView.edit()
at com.codename1.impl.android.AndroidImplementation.editString()
at com.codename1.ui.Display.editString()
at com.codename1.impl.android.AndroidKeyboard.showKeyboard()
...

Here is what I think is happening:

The code for TextArea.getRowStings() as of 3/4/2013

private Vector getRowStrings() {
        if(rowStrings == null || widthForRowCalculations != getWidth() - getUnselectedStyle().getPadding(false, RIGHT) - getUnselectedStyle().getPadding(false, LEFT)){
            initRowString();
            setShouldCalcPreferredSize(true);
        }
        return rowStrings;
    }

On line 659 (as of 3/4/2013) the code checks if rowStrings is null, then returns it.  However, it is possible that a different thread will call TextArea.setText() and set rowStrings to null before getRowStrings() completes.

a possible fix would be to change getRowStrings() declaration from
private Vector getRowStrings() to 
synchronized private Vector getRowStrings()
issues.title: NullPointerException From:   com.codename1.ui.TextArea.getLines()

Original [issue 638](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=638) created by codenameone on 2013-04-08T17:30:28.000Z:

I have the following requirement for my application:
- Be notified anytime a specific object is updated or removed from CloudStorage.
- Multiple instances of the application can register an interest in the same object.
- One instance of the application can register an interest in multiple objects.
- Some cleanup to remove dangling registrations to handle the case when the application is killed (or just left open for a long period of time).
issues.title: RFE - Notifications on CloudStorage objects

Original [issue 622](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=622) created by codenameone on 2013-03-28T02:18:18.000Z:

At line 189, the GenericListCellRenderer is checking if a component's name is null to decide if it should be added to the list of components that will be mapped to the model.

If this check could also take into account an empty string, this would allow someone using the GUI builder to simply not name a component he wants "fixed", instead of having to add the "Fixed" suffix to its name.

I really like this idea of using a Hashtable model to allow a simple and effective binding mechanism. Would using this technique at the Component level be interesting? Say if we had a method named setBindingModel(Hashtable model) (or whatever the name, in Silverlight and maybe WPF they call this the DataContext property), the Component could set its own values exactly like the GenericListCellRenderer does... If you agree, I'll start a thread on the forum to further discuss this.
issues.title: GenericListCellRenderer could check for empty names in addition to null

issues.body: Original [issue 621](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=621) created by codenameone on 2013-03-27T22:18:47.000Z: Most noticeable on the device but can occur on the simulator as well. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create a list of items with the default list model 2. Call a ImageDownloadService method that takes a list and position as arguments 3. Filter or alter the list before the ImageDownloadService has fetched the image file. 4. ImageDownloadService will request the Hashtable for the index which may now be incorrect or out of bounds. Incorrect index will put the image in the wrong list item, out of bounds throws NPE What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Would expect the list model to be checked for in range values or configurable so changes can be made. OR a simple method to stop the pending requests if the model needs to change before the images are downloaded
issues.title: ImageDownloadService throws Null Pointer Exception if the list changes before the image is downloaded

issues.body:
Original [issue 610](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=610) created by codenameone on 2013-03-23T15:59:53.000Z:

Hi

I'm developing an application that has a form that should work as a Facebook wall. I'm using the pull to refresh feature to add components to this form. The problem is that when I exit the form, or even when clearing the form components manually on the fly, the memory allocated so far remains allocated and it seems is never released.
This is causing a continous RAM usage increase over the time (no much time) until the point the system kills the process to avoid a system crash.

This is happening as far as I've tested, from Android 4+. I ran a test on an old galaxy tab with Android 2.2 and it seems this not happens, or at least the memory allocation is very low per component that I cannot observe a huge RAM usage increase over a few minutes. Running the test on Android 4+ (galaxy s3 stock rom and AOKP JB custom rom) causes a fast increase on RAM allocation (maybe related to the theme) and never gets released.

With the attached project
1. On the first screen just press the first button (no data required)
2. On the second screen just press the first button (Man icon)
3. On the third screen just pull to refresh to begin adding components. Be aware that I've detected a random NullPointerException on this feature, maybe a collision between the pull animation and adding components, so try to not pull so fast. Add 30+ components, so pull 30+ times for a noticeable RAM increase.
4. Press the back key to discard the form.
5. Realize no RAM was deallocated, or it was too little compared to the actual RAM allocated by this process.
6. Enter again the third screen (step 2) without closing the application and proceed with step 3, 4, 5 again. You'll see RAM just increasing and never decreasing. If you repeat this long enough, the device will run out of memory and the system will terminate the application.

---

Sample Project

---

Uploaded to mediafire as is too big for attachment:
http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?wpa509au1z4b94a

It's a very simple project so far but is very close to what I need to achieve.

I've created a simple navigation controller based on "Places", This is implemented in the Place and PlaceManager classes.
A place is basically module of the application that may contain a form. It has a simple lifecycle management (launched, resume, pause, finish). A place is stacked by a PlaceManager, which is responsible for calling the lifecycle methods and to pop and push places from a stack. It's very simple, just a few lines of code. I've checked and the lifecycle is being managed correctly and the stack size is consistent with this,

And then there are three places implementations: 
PL_Home: the main place. The first button on screen launches the wall place
PL_Login: dummy login, no data needed, just press the first button.
PL_Wall: empty at first but implements the pull to refresh feature to add components.
issues.title: Memory Leak

issues.body: Original [issue 598](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=598) created by codenameone on 2013-03-14T15:09:17.000Z: Please clearly state whether the issue relates to a device/the simulator or the tools. If related to a device be sure to specify exactly which device with as much details as possible. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create a navigation form. 2. In the properties tab, create a command via the popped up window. 3. The example command created had an action of 'Main', and a postaction of 'main'. 4. Reopen the commands window, and delete the command which was created. The button will disappear from the view. 5. Switch to another screen then back. The command has been reinstated and is on the navigation bar. This happens regardless of whether you saved at step 4. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The expected output is that the button on the navigation bar should disappear. Instead, the button remains on screen with its original commands. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? CodenameBuilder version 0.1, on a Mac 10.6 Codename Build number 20130225 Please provide any additional information below. One solution I found to this problem was that you could delete a command, but if only if a new one was created which takes its place. Another problem related to this was that once a command was created, any change to that command is not saved. For example, setting a postaction to go to one form, reopening the command window and changing the form selected in post action, then saving those changes doesn't work.
issues.title: GUI Builder not saving command edits.

Original [issue 594](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=594) created by codenameone on 2013-03-13T04:31:10.000Z:

My previous issue for the HTC DNA HD screen was fixed and now works great.  I ran into the same issue when running my application on my Nexus 7, when I invoke "Display.getInstance().getDeviceDensity()" it returns "30", which can be correct if the mdpi images are being scaled x1.33, although quality would obviously be degraded.

I am not sure how CN1 determines this but I assume the problem stems from the Nexus 7 being 216PPI 1280X800 classified as "tvdpi", when I was previously developing for Android, the system would usually determine that it should use "hdpi" resources for the Nexus 7 as opposed to "mdpi" which I believe CN1 is having it use.

I am not positive of the actual issue, but the images do look a lot smaller on the device than they should.
issues.title: Nexus 7 not using hdpi

Original [issue 575](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=575) created by codenameone on 2013-03-06T19:30:59.000Z:

I am trying to use a WebBrowser component to display my app help, and I am running into some problems. The help form has the following component hierarchy.

Form Help (title="Help", back command "Back"), BorderLayout
    ContainerNav (North), FlowLayout Center
        ButtonBack    (icon=ArrowLeft.png , text="")
        ButtonForward (icon=ArrowRight.png, text="")
    ContainerWeb (Center), BorderLayout
        WebBrowser (Center)

Initialization:

protected void beforeHelp(Form f) {
    ...
    WebBrowser wb = findWebBrowser(f);  
    wb.setURL("jar:///help.htm");
    f.revalidate();
}

Problem: when I open the form it is displayed correctly, but when I tap ButtonBack the following happens:
- the title area disappears (becomes black)
- ButtonForward and the background of ContainerNav disappear (become black)
- so only ButtonBack and WebBrowser are visible
- this only happens on iOS devices (iPad and iPod), not on Android devices and not in the simulator
- it only happens the first time (after program start) that the help form is opened and ButtonBack is tapped
- it does not happen if ButtonForward is tapped (first), or if ButtonBack is tapped second

See attachment for standalone project zip file reproducing the problem. ()
issues.title: Form with WebBrowser and nav buttons gives layout/visibility problems (with includeNativeBool=false)

Original [issue 574](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=574) created by codenameone on 2013-03-06T16:34:13.000Z:

When I create a new project and implement the PushCallback interface I am unable to register the application to receive GCM push notifications, when I try to register with "Display.getInstance().registerPush(auth, false);" the application crashes after a few seconds. The debug logs complains that there is a SecurityException and the READ_PHONE_STATE permission is missing.

One workaround is to add the permission above manually to the android.xpermissions build hint.

Notice that the same does not happen in the KitchenSink demo, probably because some other method adds the required READ_PHONE_STATE permission.
issues.title: Missing permission when using GCM push notification

Original [issue 553](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=553) created by codenameone on 2013-02-22T10:09:41.000Z:

Sample code attached.

To reproduce:
Click on button to display dialog
Touch input field to display keyboard
Touch outside of field to dismiss keyboard
Screen flashes black

Touch input field to display keyboard
Enter text and click Done button in keyboard
Screen flashes black as dialog closes.

Everything has to be exactly right to reproduce this problem. The dialog must be displayed over a list, the list must be using a TextArea as part of a custom cell renderer, each entry must contain a couple of lines of text. However this sample code is based on a real world application. I have a database driven list, the user wants to search the database. It is while using the search dialog that they get the black screen flashes. It is a major part of the app and the black screens are very noticable.

The only way I have found to avoid the flashes is to remove the list from the form prior to displaying the model dialog. It works fine then but it looks strange having a modal dialog over a suddenly blank screen.
issues.title: Brief black screen dismissing keyboard on iOS.

issues.body: Original [issue 529](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=529) created by codenameone on 2013-02-05T15:52:26.000Z: Please clearly state whether the issue relates to a device/the simulator or the tools. The app must defined Default-Landscape.png launch image. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? CN1 flashes Portrait, not Landscape launch image. If opened in Portrait mode the launch image is not totally correct due to assuming that launch image contains statusbar height, but it is true only for iPad. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? latest trunk Please provide any additional information below. In attachment is a simple patch to fix the issue. issues.body: Original [issue 528](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=528) created by codenameone on 2013-02-05T15:08:17.000Z: Please clearly state whether the issue relates to a device/the simulator or the tools. issues.body: Original [issue 526](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=526) created by codenameone on 2013-02-05T09:52:43.000Z: Please clearly state whether the issue relates to a device/the simulator or the tools. If related to a device be sure to specify exactly which device with as much details as possible. The issue is in core CN1 and affect both simulator and devices. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Press on a button 2. Move the pointer a bit (at least one pixel What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The button should remain to pressed state, but it is released. The problem came up on real device testing as people are used that they can move their fingers slightly while pressing the buttons. On native iOS apps the native UI is even more interesting - buttons remain pressed even then the pointer is moved away from the button but is in the close area. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? latest trunk Please provide any additional information below. It is quite an easy to fix the issue, my example patch is included. In short you need to: 1) change Button pointerDragged() method to not to change it's state to STATE_DEFAULT 2) edit Form method pointerDragged to release the button if pointer is dragged too far away 3) edit Form method pointerReleased to fire Button.released event if needed 4) add a method which defines if dragging in button close neighborhood remains button pressed svn diffs are included
issues.title: support dragging on pressed buttons

Original [issue 524](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=524) created by codenameone on 2013-02-03T21:54:12.000Z:

I've had a few StackOverflowError's reported. It looks like they are coming from the AndroidPeer init and deinit methods. Both of those methods call Disply.invokeAndBlock at the end, and wait for layoutWrapper.getParent() to be null or not null. From the stack traces, apparently this condition is never true. Over time, the init and deinit methods are called several times causing the stack to increase over time until the limit is reached.

I'm not really sure what would cause those methods to continuously block the EDT, but it is apparently happening. In my case, the AndroidPeer is a PeerComponent wrapping a TapForTap AdView object. It may be something only specific to my builds because of this, but I figured I might as well report it.

The 2 stack traces attached demonstrate this happening in both the AndroidPeer init and deinit methods.
issues.title: Android StackOverflowError

issues.body:
Original [issue 520](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=520) created by codenameone on 2013-02-01T17:36:14.000Z:

If you are using a Mac with a one button mouse, or a laptop with a track pad, then you would use Control-Click to achieve the equivalent of a right click.

However, if you are in the GUI editor and you want to activate the content popup menu for a node in the Component hierarchy, Control-Click does not work.  Command-Click does work incidentally.

I don't have a Dev environment set up to test the Resource Editor, but looking at the code I see that you are using SwingUtilities.isRightMouseButton() to detect for a right click.   Evidently on Mac, this function doesn't behave properly for control-clicks.

This tutorial suggests using isPopupTrigger() for these sorts of things - I'm not sure if this will fix the issue.
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/uiswing/components/menu.html#popup

Other suggestions (from this Stackoverflow thread) include using MouseEvent.isControlDown()
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2972512/how-to-detect-right-click-event-for-mac-os

This is more a usability issue.  I stumbled across this when I needed to delete an element from the GUI layout and I was using my Macbook Air.  I couldn't find a way to do it because I couldn't get the contextual menu to open.  I thought, for a while, that I had somehow corrupted my resource file, but was happy, after some experimenting, to find that the context menu was just coming up on the wrong key.

Additional/alternative usability tweaks might include adding a top level menu (or at least some other way) to delete the currently selected element from the GUI editor.
issues.title: Right click on node in Component Hierarchy of GUI editor incorrect on Mac

issues.body:
Original [issue 515](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=515) created by codenameone on 2013-01-30T16:40:17.000Z:

On BBOS4.5, if you call setPost(false) on ConnectionRequest, an error is thrown "connection not writable".  To resolve in my code, I simply used setPost(true), just so that the connection is opened with write access, but that's not the proper solution.

Not sure what the best way to handle this is, appears the bug started in BBOS 4.5 and was fixed sometime before BBOS6.  My 9790 is not affected by this bug.

More details here:

http://www.coderholic.com/blackberry-os-45-connection-not-writeable-error/
issues.title: BlackBerry 4.5 bug - "connection not writable" on GET request
BB OS5: Display.lockOrientation() works incorrectly

issues.body:
Original [issue 503](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=503) created by codenameone on 2013-01-26T01:41:56.000Z:

If you place a button in an EmbeddedContainer that is set up with a "Back" command, it fires the "Back" command of the root form instead of the EmbeddedContainer.

I have attached a patch to correct this issue.  Now it will use the navigation stack for the parent embedded container of the button if it exists.
issues.title: Back command in Embedded Container uses root navigation stack

issues.body:
Original [issue 502](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=502) created by codenameone on 2013-01-26T00:41:53.000Z:

Button commands set up through the ResourceEditor cause a ClassCastException when inside embedded components.  This appears to be because some of the code in the handler assumes that getSource() and getDestination() return a Form.  This is not the case if the transition is initiated inside an Embedded container.

I have attached the stacktrace of the exception (running off the trunk).
I have also attached a patch that fixes the issue for me.  However, I have only fixed the paths that affect my application right now.  It might be a good idea to look through the rest of the transitions to see if similar assumptions have been made  (you know how it is... where a mistake is made once, it is likely that it is made many times).

-Steve
issues.title: Transitions in Embedded Components throw exceptions

issues.body:
Original [issue 501](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=501) created by codenameone on 2013-01-24T18:37:00.000Z:

I just changed my package documentation for my js package to use package-info.java instead of package.html.  This has caused the iOS build to fail on the build server (haven't tested android yet).

I have attached the error log.  Is it easy to have the build server delete all package-info.java files before building to prevent this problem?

The reason I switched to package-info.java was because I figured the package.html file would be kept in the final executable as a resource... and this would add to the final size unnecessarily.  Perhaps you guys already dealt with that issue.

In any case, it would be nice to be able to use package-info.java for package documentation as this seems to be the recommended way going forward.

I have attached the build error log.
issues.title: package-info.java on build server

issues.body: Original [issue 500](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=500) created by codenameone on 2013-01-24T18:00:10.000Z: When overriding a theme component of a certain state and setting its base derive to that component state but that theme component state doesn't exists will cause a stackoverflowexception once the component will try to change its style state to that stated (selected in my case) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. create a native theme app 2. edit the theme and add "Ads" theme customization for unselected, selected, pressed states and in each of those states set the base derive-from component of Ads and the relevant state (unselected, selected, pressed) 3. add an Ads component to the main form. 4. launch the app in a pure-touch device and set the focus to the Ads component. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The app should function properly, instead the app crashes with stackoverflowexception. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? eclipse, win7, cn1 plugin 201210220011
issues.title: Overriding a non-existing state (selected) of a theme causes a stackoverflowexception

issues.body: Original [issue 499](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=499) created by codenameone on 2013-01-24T06:05:50.000Z: Please clearly state whether the issue relates to a device/the simulator or the tools. device and simulator If related to a device be sure to specify exactly which device with as much details as possible. all j2me cellphones What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Enter something in textfield using virtual keyboard 2.now notice that on virtual keyboard's input field cursor is moving left to right with entered letter but not on actual textfield 3.now dont press ok on virtual keyboard, press over actual textfiled it do not saves entered text and dont displays in actual textfield What is the expected output? What do you see instead? 1.cursor should move on virtual keyboards input fields as well as on actual textfield 2.if user press on textfield instead of ok button on virtual keyboard it should save entered text 3.i think input field on vkb is not needed follow android keyboard where we directly enter text on actual textfield or textarea What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? version:1.0.30 Please provide any additional information below.
issues.title: virtual keyboard problem on j2me cellphones

Original [issue 492](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=492) created by codenameone on 2013-01-18T03:52:26.000Z:

(Present in trunk as I'm writing this)

When renaming a gui element (like a form) via the Edit->Rename menu, it seems like the underlying model is not notified. As a result, the StateMachineBase methods generated in com.codename1.designer.ResourceEditorView at line 2389 are not writing accurate code. Closing and reopening the Designer doesn't help.

However, if after that rename you simply modify any property of that GUI element via the property sheet (tab "Properties"), the generated code properly writes the findXYZ() when saving.

I really hoped I would also be able to submit a fix, but I'm only starting to get familiar with your sources. I'll be happy to report issues and hopefully some fixes as I'm finding them. I feel the Designer is really an area I could help with.
issues.title: StateMachineBase not correctly updated after renaming a gui element in Designer

Original [issue 485](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=485) created by codenameone on 2013-01-14T07:35:42.000Z:

With the previous addNavigationCallback feature, I introduced a bug in the iOS onStart event that prevented the URL from being relayed.  This is very serious as it breaks OAuth!!!  (my bad...)

The problem has been reported in the forum here:
http://www.codenameone.com/discussion-forum.html?place=msg%2Fcodenameone-discussions%2FyMKSP6pfmws%2FqU08DWAXOGAJ

The patch to fix this issue is attached.

Big mistake on my part... will be more careful next time....

-Steve

The real problem is the dialog bounce up transition.

Original [issue 473](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=473) created by codenameone on 2013-01-09T15:31:25.000Z:

On a T-mobile myTouch q by Huawei, when using the physical keyboard, pressing the enter key does not seem to move the cursor to the next input field.  This behavior is also seen in the simulator, pressing enter on my computer keyboard does not move the cursor to the next field.

My application is a simple one that I am using just for to get my feet wet, and is composed of a main screen with two containers in it.  In one container I have two labels, two input fields and a button.  The container that contains these fields is using a table layout, with 3 rows and 2 columns.  The first two rows of the table contain one label and a text field.  The last row of the table has a button that expands the fulls screen.  The text field in the second row 2/column 2, is a password field.

The second container is also a table layout, with 1 row and 3 columns, with a button in the row 1/column 2.  This button is only shown when the platform name is "iOs", otherwise it is hidden.
issues.title: Enter key on physical keyboard not moving to next field

issues.body: Original [issue 472](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=472) created by codenameone on 2013-01-07T15:29:43.000Z: J2me build now fails when a funtion has a vector paramater (and maybe other containers) and in the function body exists an anonymous class object initialization. Took me a few hours and alot of builds to catch this extreamly strange (new?) bug. The error on the build log indicate that it cant find the enclosed method... What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. create a new project 2. add a new method that has a vector arguement 3. add an anonymous class new object initialization in the above method and call it from the start method 4. send j2me build to server. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? build should be completed successfully, instead build fails because it is unable to find the new method. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? eclipse, win7, cn1 plugin 201210220011

issues.body:
Original [issue 465](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=465) created by codenameone on 2013-01-03T18:36:45.000Z:

An issue posted in the forum (http://www.codenameone.com/discussion-forum.html?place=topic%2Fcodenameone-discussions%2FsMp8y9dtYpw%2Fdiscussion) could possibly be related to the Android cookie patch from issue # 450.

Potentially this exception could be caused if a network request is sent but the CookieSyncManager hasn't been initialized yet.

I haven't been able to reproduce this problem even if I create a fresh app with no WebBrowser component and try to work with cookies.  However it is possible that my version of Android just handles this problem some other way.

In looking through the code, I realize that the getCookiesForURL() method that currently overrides the default implementation is unnecessary.  (I thought I had deleted this before the original patch, but I guess I left it in).  Since it is unnecessary (cookies are copied between the CookieManager and Codenameone as they are added to the respective stores... so no need to override), I have removed it (patch attached).

This patch also includes some defensive code to detect the IllegalStateException and create a CookieSyncManager if necessary.  I am hopeful that this will resolve the issue in in the above discussion forum thread.
issues.title: Android cookie IllegalStateException

Original [issue 462](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=462) created by codenameone on 2013-01-01T11:04:57.000Z:

The property Display.getInstance().getProperty("AppName","default"))
Currently it returns activity.getApplicationInfo().name, there are a 
couple of things that are wrong with that, for once the Application 
tag is often left empty which makes this return a null (the return 
value is not checked and default value is not used), Secondly the name 
member is a Class name which isnt very good to return to the user a 
much better return is the localized Label property for either the 
Application tag or the Activity tag in that order.

The iOS Port currently ignores the baseURL parameter of the WebBrowser.setPage() method. I have attached a patch to fix this issue.  Tested on iOS 4.

(the previous comment in the source code indicating that any value other than Nil caused a crash appears to be because they were trying to pass a string to this parameter, when it actually takes an NSURL object).

issues.body:
Original [issue 455](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=455) created by codenameone on 2012-12-27T08:34:16.000Z:

Currently exposeInJavascript is not implemented on iOS.  I believe I can implement it without too much difficulty if we add a marker interface "JavascriptInterface" to the CodenameOne API to mark classes that should be "web scriptable".

The implementation would require some code generation stubs (similar to the ones generated for Native Interfaces) but this won't be difficult to create using an AnnotationProcessor.

I would be following the strategy that Cordova uses for this sort of thing.  E.g.
https://github.com/apache/incubator-cordova-ios/blob/master/CordovaLib/Classes/CDVViewController.m

Since this would require the generation of stubs, it would make the most sense to add the generation of these stubs on the build server.

Do you have any comments, concerns, or objections about this proposed implementation?

-Steve
issues.title: exposeInJavascript iOS implementation

issues.body:
Original [issue 454](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=454) created by codenameone on 2012-12-27T08:00:20.000Z:

The Android implementation of the BrowserComponent currently implements a WebViewClient to call back into CodenameOne.  It does not implement a WebChromeClient, however, which could offer much more variety of callbacks, including handing alert dialogs, console log messages, and more.
http://developer.android.com/reference/android/webkit/WebChromeClient.html

I would like to implement all of the methods (that are appropriate) and provide corresponding events or callbacks in the public CodenameOne API so that web views can be better utilized.  Do you have any concerns or objections?
issues.title: Android BrowserComponent implementation (WebChromeClient)

issues.body:
Original [issue 453](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=453) created by codenameone on 2012-12-27T07:45:27.000Z:

The BrowserComponent.exposeInJavascript() method currently wraps the android WebView.addJavascriptInterface() method.  As of Jelly Bean MR1, only methods with the @JavascriptInterface annotation will be accessible from Javascript. 
http://developer.android.com/reference/android/webkit/WebView.html#addJavascriptInterface(java.lang.Object, java.lang.String)
"For applications targeted to API level JELLY_BEAN_MR1 and above, only public methods that are annotated with JavascriptInterface can be accessed from JavaScript."

Since applications are written for an older version of Java I'm not sure if we can include this annotation in CodenameOne app code and have them remain portable.  I propose the creation of a marker Java Interface named JavascriptInterface (perhaps in the com.codename1.ui package)  so that any object that implements this interface can be transformed by the build-server to conform to Android's requirement  (the build server could take this interface and use an AnnotationProcessor to add the @JavascriptInterface annotation to all public methods so that they would be accessible by the WebView.

Of course, if you already have this problem solved with an alternate solution, then please let me know.

-Steve
issues.title: exposeInJavascript implementation

issues.body: Original [issue 447](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=447) created by codenameone on 2012-12-23T12:11:35.000Z: the Resource class selects the first image from a multi image instead of its nearest one to that DPI. When the Resource class checks the current DPI to choose the proper image from a multi image and the current DPI is smaller than all other DPI available for that image it select the image based on the order the images were entered and not the next DPI. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. prepare a theme with multi image of medium, high dpi, very high dpi & hd and load them with different orders. 2. use that image in a form of a device with low dpi 3. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? expected output: should be the image used and shown on the form is of the medium dpi. actual result: the image displayed is based on the order in which the images were loaded to the multi image What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? eclipse, win7, cn1 20121221 Please provide any additional information below. the problem is in the Resource class in method readMultiImage(DataInputStream input, boolean skipAll) if there isnt a less then or equal dpi available of the image then bestFitOffset is still set to 0 which mean it will use the image depanding on the order in which they were loaded. Fix: set the bestFitOffset to -1 and after checking the less than or equal if bestFitOffset < 0 you should add another check for closest larger than dpi and set the bestFitOffset to it and rest of code should remain.
issues.title: MultiImage selecting issue

issues.body: Original [issue 431](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=431) created by codenameone on 2012-12-13T11:28:38.000Z: Currently in iOS the following is not supporting subdirectories with getResourceAsStream and all resource files should be placed in the root dir, that is the following: Display.getInstance().getResourceAsStream(classLoader, "/data/image.png"); returns always null in iOS. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? SVN trunk rev625. Please provide any additional information below. CN1 do not need too many changes to support subdirs in iOS. The patch for Ports/iOS dir is attached. Basically You only need to change NSString\* path = [[NSBundle mainBundle] pathForResource:nameNS ofType:typeNS]; to NSString\* path = [[NSBundle mainBundle] pathForResource:nameNS ofType:typeNS inDirectory:dirNS]; in getResourceSize and loadResourceFile in CodenameOne_GLViewController.m. And also iOS building process needs to be modified to add resource directories to the xcode project.
issues.title: iOS to support directories with getResourceAsStream

Original [issue 421](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=421) created by codenameone on 2012-12-11T11:44:48.000Z:

I am storing text in an SQLite database that contains some accented characters. On return from SQLite the data is garbled. Something is wrong in the character encoding on iOS. It works fine on the simulator.

It is easy to reproduce. Use the SQLSample app you provide. Change one of the users names to include accented characters. For example:

```
private String[] users = new String[]{"Sinéad O'Connor", "Shai Almog",
    "Bill gates", "Mark zuckerberg", "Larry Page"};
```

The é in Sinéad is accented, hope that comes through.

Run it on iOS. A screenshot is attached.

SQLite use is not really practical on iOS without proper encoding.

Thanks.
issues.title: iOS SQLite implementation cannot handle accented characters
