issues.body:
Original [issue 418](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=418) created by codenameone on 2012-12-10T20:24:16.000Z:

If you load a map and then aysnc load in 'pins' and put them as PointLayers on a PointsLayer they are not drawn until the user touches the map.  

I think the key here is that the PointLayer s are added asyc (via ConnectionRequest) 

I had a look through the code and pointerReleased disposes of the Image buffer before repainting. Its been painted before the pins are added and not moved or zoomed so the drawn image is cached and not updated when a layer is added therefore pins don't show until after user interaction.

Hack for now by calling map.pointerPressed(0,0) and map.pointerReleased(0,0) after the PointLayer is added makes them appear correctly.
issues.title: PointLayers on map not drawn until after user interaction if they are added after the map is initially drawn.

issues.body: Original [issue 407](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=407) created by codenameone on 2012-11-28T09:10:40.000Z: On Android if a user doesn't have the 'Barcode Scanner' app they are prompted to download it from the app store before continuing. There are a number of other apps (e.g., QRDroid) that register for the same intent and can be used but these are not detected. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Install QRDroid 2. Build a simple app that uses CodeScanner 3. You will be prompted to also download BarcodeScanner What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The action com.google.zxing.client.android.SCAN is recognized by a number of barcode scanning apps. If any are installed they should be used instead of prompting the user to download a different but duplicate app. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Running on Android, tested on 2.3, 4.0 and 4.1.2 Please provide any additional information below. The ZXing demo that uses the native interface instead of CodeScanner can recognize QRDroid and others and uses them without issue. This issue occurs when using the new CodeScanner class, this implementation must have a hard dependency on a specific app.
issues.title: CodeScanner on Android requires Barcode Scanner on Android even if equivilent app is installed.

Original [issue 402](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=402) created by codenameone on 2012-11-24T23:44:23.000Z:

The simulator needs to handle the Home button in iOS mode, the same way it handles the Menu & Back buttons in Android mode.

My iOS app has no Back button on the main screen in accordance with iOS conventions. It also saves settings in the stop() method. There is no way to exit the app and have the stop() method called. 

I can close the simulator but that does not call stop(). I need a way to close my app in the simulator that calls the stop() method so that I can save settings.
issues.title: iOS Simulator needs to handle Home button

issues.body:
Original [issue 401](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=401) created by codenameone on 2012-11-24T20:52:19.000Z:

I have a TextField and have added an actionListener.

In the simulator actionPerformed is called when I hit the Enter key. On Android it is called when I touch the Done button on the virtual keyboard.

On iOS it is never called. I was expecting it to be called when I touch the Done button on the virtual keyboard.

For example I have a search field, use enters data and hits Done. I want the search to start immediately. This happens on Android  but on iOS the user must hit Done to close the keyboard and then click on a search button to start the search.
issues.title: TextField actionPerformed never called on iOS

also - the arc is created and filled in the wrong place - in the simulator/android, the provided position and size indicate the bounding box of the whole circle/ellipse from which the arc is taken, while in iOS it determines the bounding box of the arc.

Ram.

issues.body:
Original [issue 397](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=397) created by codenameone on 2012-11-21T00:35:07.000Z:

See related discussion: http://www.codenameone.com/discussion-forum.html?place=topic%2Fcodenameone-discussions%2FwuLpRMle4sU%2Fdiscussion

Important note: When building this app for iOS you will need to include the ios.fileSharingEnabled=true build property. (Thanks for adding that).

I have come up with a small test program that reproduces this problem. The app runs fine in the simulator and on Android but crashes on iOS. When I get the source and run the app in XDev, the app runs but a GC Warning message is displayed at the point the app normally crashes. The I/O runs on a thread, it will display Done!! if it completes.

The line that causes the crash is: Storage.getInstance().writeObject(dbName, rows); 

This app reads in a file from an external source, creates a Vector and then saves the Vector to local storage so that we have a local copy of the file next time. It will run pretty slow because I ripped out the buffering code I had in readLine.

I have also attached two test files in a zip file that you will need to reproduce the problem. MobileTestDB.rw3.data is the smallest and the best to test with. Books.rw3.data is much larger, might be useful once you have fixed the problem for a bit of stress testing.

When running this app in the Simulator copy the test file to one of your roots, i.e. C:\MobileTestDB.rw3.data. When running on an iOS device you will need to sync the file using iTunes. The program will find the first .rw3.data file so don't put both there as it will find the larger Books file.

I would appreciate it if you let me know what you find. I can continue development using smaller datasets which work. But if there is something wrong with my approach, then I will need to get started on redesigning it.

Thanks,

Martin
mwarnett@readerware.com
issues.title: iOS app crashes after GC Warning

issues.body:
Original [issue 345](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=345) created by codenameone on 2012-09-23T12:13:56.000Z:

BlackBerry OS version 6.x and older only support HTTP 1.0, which causes an output stream to be closed as soon as flush() is called.  BBOS 7.0 and newer no longer has this issue so the patch does not apply to those devices.

Relates to issue 214, and any code that opens an HTTP output stream on BlackBerry devices with OS 6.0 and older (ie. affects both BB ports). 

Attached patch to fix both BB ports, synchronized against the lastest code in SVN.  Tested successfully on a 9790 (BBOS 7) and an 8320 (BBOS 4.6).

Reference:
http://supportforums.blackberry.com/t5/Java-Development/HTTP-POST-Problem/m-p/59716/highlight/true#M6647
issues.title: BlackBerry devices with OS 6.0 or older close HTTP OutputStream on flush()

issues.body: Original [issue 342](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=342) created by codenameone on 2012-09-21T08:29:50.000Z: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Attach an ActionListener to a NetworkManager 2. Use ConnectionRequest to read, and MultipartConnectionRequest to write. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? When reading, the EOS (-1) is added to the total bytes read, so progress will hit 100% then drop to 99% before finalizing. When writing, the NetworkEvents are always sent with NetworkEvent.PROGRESS_TYPE_INPUT. Please provide any additional information below. Attached is a patch synchronized against latest in SVN to fix both issues.
issues.title: Incorrect IOProgress events in BufferedInputStream and ConnectionRequest

issues.body:
Original [issue 338](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=338) created by codenameone on 2012-09-18T09:19:15.000Z:

When passing files by inputstream to the MultipartRequest, the entire file is sent to the outputstream, which is buffered, without flushing, which severly limit the max filesize that can be sent on limited devices.  Attached an update (synchronized to lastest in SVN) to flush the outputstream every 8K.  This same optimization can be done when passing files by byte arrays, but the attached patch does not address this.

If this patch resolves the issue noted in this thread, I'll file a patch to handle the byte array files as well:

http://www.codenameone.com/discussion-forum.html?place=topic%2Fcodenameone-discussions%2FUqIGvfKVfnA%2Fdiscussion
issues.title: MultipartRequest memory use optimization when passing by InputStream

issues.body: Original [issue 334](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=334) created by codenameone on 2012-09-17T08:50:17.000Z: Hi all, There seems to be UI issues with the CodenameOne BlackBerry port. When trying to set textfield type to password [textField.setConstraint(TextField.NUMERIC | TextField.PASSWORD) or textField.setConstraint(TextField.PASSWORD)], the textfield doesn't render any input at all. Also one cannot move the input cursor in a textfield. Also, there are some issues with native virtual keyboard, for example, there is some flickering when the native keyboard is shown or hidden. Please clearly state whether the issue relates to a device/the simulator or the tools. If related to a device be sure to specify exactly which device with as much details as possible. Tested on BlackBerry Torch 9800 [a BlackBerry OS 6 touchscreen and QWERTY device] and BlackBerry Bold 9780 [a BlackBerry OS 6 QWERTY device]. Both tested devices have the same UI issues. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. textField.setConstraint(TextField.NUMERIC | TextField.PASSWORD) or textField.setConstraint(TextField.PASSWORD) What is the expected output? What do you see instead? TextField doesn't render any input when set to type password, the textfield stays empty. One cannot move the input cursor in a textfield. There is some flickering when the native keyboard is shown or hidden. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Latest CodenameOne JavaME BlackBerry OS 5 code from CodenameOne svn repository. Please provide any additional information below. Please fix ;) Thanks.

issues.body: Original [issue 331](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=331) created by codenameone on 2012-09-15T07:52:39.000Z: The send SMS functionality in iOS is not working properly. It starts the sendSMS application screen and just remains in that screen. There are buttons for cancel and send, however they don't close the sendSMS window. The send, actually sends the SMS in the background, but since the window still remains open, user does not know, wether the message was really sent or not. Also cancel does not cancel the sendSMS operation. The only way to come out, is to press the center button on iphone. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Use the Display.sendSMS functionality to send an SMS. 2. 3. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The sendSMS functionality should ideally send the SMS in the background and return back to the caller. issues.body:
Original [issue 327](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=327) created by codenameone on 2012-09-14T03:44:00.000Z:

I was able to reproduce the issue on BlackBerry 5.0 phones (9300) and simulator.  The issue does not occur on touch-screen simulator.

To reproduce a problem:
1.  Create a simple form with vertical BoxLayout
3.  Populate for with buttons, checkboxes, etc.

Normally you can use the touch sensor to move up and down between controls (change focus).  

However, sometimes you are unable to move up.  You slide your finger up over the touch sensor but the focus does not change. You can still move down until the focus gets set to the bottom-most control and stays there.

I am using CodenameOne plug-in for Eclipse 1.0.0.201209071238

A note:
Setting focus scrolling to true: 

UIManager.getInstance().getLookAndFeel().setFocusScrolling(true);

completely fixes the issue

issues.body:
Original [issue 320](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=320) created by codenameone on 2012-09-08T20:32:06.000Z:

When using a WebBrowser on Android, when I restart the app on a form that has a WebBrowser component, I have encountered these two exceptions:

09-08 13:35:26.420: E/AndroidRuntime(5382): FATAL EXCEPTION: main
09-08 13:35:26.420: E/AndroidRuntime(5382): java.lang.NullPointerException
09-08 13:35:26.420: E/AndroidRuntime(5382):     at android.webkit.WebView.requestFocus(WebView.java:7650)
09-08 13:35:26.420: E/AndroidRuntime(5382):     at android.view.View.requestFocus(View.java:5323)
09-08 13:35:26.420: E/AndroidRuntime(5382):     at android.view.View.requestFocusFromTouch(View.java:5401)
09-08 13:35:26.420: E/AndroidRuntime(5382):     at com.codename1.impl.android.AndroidImplementation$AndroidPeer$8.run(Unknown Source)
09-08 13:35:26.420: E/AndroidRuntime(5382):     at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:605)
09-08 13:35:26.420: E/AndroidRuntime(5382):     at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:92)
09-08 13:35:26.420: E/AndroidRuntime(5382):     at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137)
09-08 13:35:26.420: E/AndroidRuntime(5382):     at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4424)
09-08 13:35:26.420: E/AndroidRuntime(5382):     at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method)
09-08 13:35:26.420: E/AndroidRuntime(5382):     at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:511)
09-08 13:35:26.420: E/AndroidRuntime(5382):     at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:784)
09-08 13:35:26.420: E/AndroidRuntime(5382):     at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:551)
09-08 13:35:26.420: E/AndroidRuntime(5382):     at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)

09-08 13:04:12.381: E/AndroidRuntime(4638): FATAL EXCEPTION: main
09-08 13:04:12.381: E/AndroidRuntime(4638): java.lang.NullPointerException
09-08 13:04:12.381: E/AndroidRuntime(4638):     at android.webkit.WebView.requestFocus(WebView.java:7650)
09-08 13:04:12.381: E/AndroidRuntime(4638):     at android.view.ViewGroup.onRequestFocusInDescendants(ViewGroup.java:2154)
09-08 13:04:12.381: E/AndroidRuntime(4638):     at android.view.ViewGroup.requestFocus(ViewGroup.java:2113)
09-08 13:04:12.381: E/AndroidRuntime(4638):     at android.view.View.requestFocus(View.java:5323)
09-08 13:04:12.381: E/AndroidRuntime(4638):     at android.view.View.requestFocus(View.java:5301)
09-08 13:04:12.381: E/AndroidRuntime(4638):     at com.codename1.impl.android.AndroidImplementation$AndroidPeer$9.run(Unknown Source)
09-08 13:04:12.381: E/AndroidRuntime(4638):     at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:605)
09-08 13:04:12.381: E/AndroidRuntime(4638):     at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:92)
09-08 13:04:12.381: E/AndroidRuntime(4638):     at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137)
09-08 13:04:12.381: E/AndroidRuntime(4638):     at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4424)
09-08 13:04:12.381: E/AndroidRuntime(4638):     at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method)
09-08 13:04:12.381: E/AndroidRuntime(4638):     at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:511)
09-08 13:04:12.381: E/AndroidRuntime(4638):     at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:784)
09-08 13:04:12.381: E/AndroidRuntime(4638):     at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:551)
09-08 13:04:12.381: E/AndroidRuntime(4638):     at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)

I believe that these NPE's are happening because AndroidBrowserComponent.deinitialize calls destroy() on the WebView, at which point no other methods may be called on the WebView. When the app goes to the background, AndroidBrowserComponent is deinitialized; therefore, when the app restarts the underlying WebView is no longer valid causing the NPE.

A better way would be to have a destroy() (or similarly named method) on the WebBrowser component so that the developer can destroy the component manually when it is known that it is no longer needed.
issues.title: AndroidPeer$8,$9 cause NPE in WebView when using AndroidBrowserComponent

issues.body:
Original [issue 314](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=314) created by codenameone on 2012-09-03T22:21:12.000Z:

In my latest build, I noticed that multiple instances of my application activity stub and the same number of AndroidImplementation instances were created (in my case there were 9 instances of each in the heap dump). However, there was only one instance of my main application. These multiple instances caused the memory usage to be very high (about 50 mb). In addition, when exiting the app, it took 9 calls to Display.exitApplication to finally get the app to exit.

This leads me to believe that the issue that I brought up in my discussion post "Possible Memory Leaks in Android/Action Bar Errors" were not completely fixed. Apparently there is now only one single static instance of the main app class, but that did not fix the issue with many activity stubs and implementations being created - which still leads to a serious bug and memory leak.

I believe (and feel free to correct me) that in case of AndroidImplementation, there should only ever be one instance created. This is because it seems that AndroidPeer objects expect the same AndroidImplementation instance to be active when the app restarts as they access fields of their AndroidImplemenation outer class.  Currently, the way ImplementationFactory and Display work, a new AndroidImplementationis created every time the Display is initialized when the app starts. This will cause any AndroidPeer's already created to not function correctly (I think this was the problem in issue 312 that I submitted).

In the case of multiple activity stubs being created, this should not happen if the app is set to only have one activity by setting the launchMode to "singleTask" in the manifest.
issues.title: Android build creates multiple instances of activity stub and AndroidImplementation

Create a simple form with a List control in it (use attached example). 2. Click on the first item in the list (index 0) and the selected index will change to 1. 3. What do you see instead? - Selected index is 1 greater then the one actually selected. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? - Latest version of CN1 on Android OS 2.2 and 2.3 I've created a different example with a Label, List, and Button in a form. The problem persists, everything seems to be shifted. When testing on a real device I've found that rotating the screen to force a layout change will fix the issue.

When calling the BrowserComponent methods (and therefore the WebBrowser mehtods), I get the following error in the DDMS log:

"java.lang.Throwable: Warning: A WebView method was called on thread 'EDT'. All WebView methods must be called on the UI thread. Future versions of WebView may not support use on other threads."

The AndroidBrowserComponent class inside AndroidImplementation should call all the WebView methods on the web property on the UI thread using activity.runOnUiThread.

I am using v1.0.14 in Netbeans 7.2 (just updated that too) on a Windows 7 OS.

issues.body:
Original [issue 242](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=242) created by codenameone on 2012-07-04T20:42:43.000Z:

A couple observations from the new code introspection for app permissions:
- An unmodified app created using the 'hello world' template, requests for full internet access and full read/write access to USB/SDCard storage on Android devices.  It should require no permissions at all.
- In one of my apps, I am using my VASE API for certain functions.  Because VASE has some GPS related utilities, the app is requesting access to the GPS on the physical device, even though the app doesn't access that code.  Of course, I could import the specific code of the library I require for this app, but moving forward, when 3rd party libraries are enabled, I believe this may become a problem.

issues.body: Original [issue 195](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=195) created by codenameone on 2012-05-24T00:12:15.000Z: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Let's encode carriage return line feed \r\n 2. com.codename1.ui.html.HTMLUtils.encodeString("\r\n"); give "%0D%0A", it's ok ! 3. com.codename1.io.Util.encodeUrl("\r\n"); give "%D%A", it's BAD ! It can't be decoded after that ! 4. WORSE : com.codename1.io.ConnectionRequest.addArgument(String, String); use the BAD method, and then, the encoded GET or POST can't be decoded by java EE (or other) and we get an error : "INFO: Parameters: Character decoding failed..." and fail to process GET or POST request. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? For CRLN : Expected : "%0D%0A" See : "%D%A" What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? CNO last updated on May 16th 2012, inside NetBeans 7.0.1 Please provide any additional information below. It's an heavy issue, no argument with line feed or carriage return can be sent by GET or POST. I didn't checked other encodings, but it's more than possible that com.codename1.io.Util.encodeUrl and com.codename1.io.ConnectionRequest.addArgument make other errors. It seems that they forget to format %xx in two hexa digits when the left one is 0. Workaround : use com.codename1.ui.html.HTMLUtils.encodeString and then com.codename1.io.ConnectionRequest.addArgumentNoEncoding
issues.title: encodeUrl and addArgument make a bad encoding with % replacements - for example it crashes Tomcat request processing

issues.body:
Original [issue 184](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=184) created by codenameone on 2012-05-05T06:40:16.000Z:

Sorry for combining this into one, but here's a patch to fix some bugs in the path processor:

getAsBoolean() - "0" is returning true.
getAs*Array() - NPE when path produces no matches

And added the following enhancements:
- new untyped get() method for paths that point to vector/hashtable (in json) or element (in xml)
- new getAs_Array() to match the getAs_() methods:
  - getAsDoubleArray()
  - getAsLongArray()
  - getAsBooleanArray() (for consistency)
issues.title: Bugs/Enhancements in the path processor

issues.body:
Original [issue 183](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=183) created by codenameone on 2012-05-05T06:26:08.000Z:

For binary data, the data is being written before the start boundary markers, and an extra CRLF (2 total) is being sent before the end boundary marker. Attached a patch to fix.

Original [issue 177](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=177) created by codenameone on 2012-04-25T06:10:28.000Z:

A newly created Codename One project does not link the Javadoc and sources to the 
CodenameOne.jar, so Code Assist is not as helpful (screenshots attached).

As a workaround, after creating a new project, right-click the project, select Project, Properties, Java Build Path, Libraries tab, open CodenameOne.jar node, set the Source attachment to the CodenameOne_SRC.zip from the workspace, and set the Javadoc Location to https://codenameone.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/CodenameOne/javadoc/
issues.title: Eclipse plug-in - Javadoc and Sources not linked

issues.body: Original [issue 156](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=156) created by codenameone on 2012-04-15T10:29:54.000Z: For applications that use io.Storage (e.g. apps ported from J2ME RMS), it would be very useful to be able to export the underlying file used by Storage, e.g. to backup your data, or to export your data if you move to new device. What do you see instead? I guess an interface like getStorageFile(), putStorageFile() would suffice.

issues.body: Original [issue 136](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=136) created by codenameone on 2012-04-09T17:38:31.000Z: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. DefaultListModel list = new DefaultListModel(); 2.ContainerList contList = new ContainerList(list); //since isInitialized() is false, bindListeners() isn't called, and therefore contList doesn't add itself to list's listeners 3.list.addItem(new Integer()); When addItem calls fireDataChangedEvent, the ContainerList is not informed and does not recalculate its size in updateComponentCount(). What is the expected output? What do you see instead? This is quite a severe problem, since if you start with a small list of say 5 elements, then when you add more elements, the ContainerList will never show more than the first 5 elements. In the lwuit demo, this problem doesn't appear since the list is fixed size. Also true in latest version of CN1.
issues.title: ContainerList never starts listening to its model and therefore doesn't update its size when the size of the model changes

issues.body: Original [issue 134](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=134) created by codenameone on 2012-04-09T10:27:37.000Z: What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Hours and Minutes with values below 10 in the spinning wheels are left adjusted instead of right adjusted which looks wrong. At least it is the case in the default native skins for android and iphone. For minutes the right solution could be to add a leading a 0 to values below 10, e.g. show "05" minutes instead of "5".
issues.title: TimeSpinner show hours and minutes left-adjusted and minutes below 10 without leading 0

issues.body: Original [issue 132](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=132) created by codenameone on 2012-04-09T08:48:47.000Z: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. create a Time or DateSpinner with any value 2. move the spinner wheels to a new value, e.g. from day 16 to 17. 3. even when new value 17 is within the highlighted area, and the old value 16 is moved outside, and you let go of the wheel, it spins back to 16. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? To get best usability, the new value should just be partially within the highlighted area (e.g. more inside the area than the old value). This will be the most intuitive solution: whatever value is most within the area is used. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? issues.body:
Original [issue 118](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=118) created by codenameone on 2012-03-28T06:09:24.000Z:

The path processor in build 20120325 has some features missing from the JSON handler:
- globbing not supported (// expression)
- parent selecting not supported (.. expression)
- getAs*Array() functions throws cast exceptions
- text predicates not working when lvalue path points to an array

There are also a few issues in both the JSON and XML handlers:
- getAsArray() returns array of private StructuredContent object not usable by end user.
- getAs*Array() throws cast exceptions when selecting attributes in xml

The attached update is sync'd with current svn with updates to resolve everything above, the JSON and XML processing should work exactly the same now.  This will be the last I proactively enhance features for now unless there's any specific requests.
issues.title: Path expression language processor for json missing some features
JSON Parser is stripping sign from negative numbers

issues.body: Original [issue 96](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=96) created by codenameone on 2012-03-15T16:29:37.000Z: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Try writing a byte[] object using the Util.writeObject() method 2. 3. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? It should have written the byte array to storage, but this code fails with a crash on iOS port. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? public beta version released on 12 march 2012. On Mac OS and iphone 4 (running os 5.1) Please provide any additional information below. On looking at the iOS port code and putting some debug stmts. I found out that xmlvm is byte[] array objects as org.xmlvm.runtime.XMLVMArray type and when this object is passed to the Util.instanceofObjArray() method it returns true. So though the actual object in java code is byte[], it is interpreted by the codename1 io.Util class to be of type Object Array. and then when it tries to write it, the app fails with a crash on actual device. The solution would be to check for object array instance at the end in the method Util.writeObject(). Currently this check is being done before checking for byte[], short[] and other array types. I tested the code with this change and it is working. Please review the code and do the necessary changes in Util.java.
issues.title: Util.writeObject() not working in iOS port for byte[] type of member field

issues.body: Original [issue 94](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=94) created by codenameone on 2012-03-15T15:45:18.000Z: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. issues.body: Original [issue 57](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=57) created by codenameone on 2012-03-03T12:06:44.000Z: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. If there is a Java source file with import java.io.*; and some code is referring to java.io.ByteArrayInputStream class. 2. Compile the codename1 project. 3. And send the project for j2me build. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Ideally the build should get compiled, but on build server it gives error: can't find referenced class java.io.FilterInputStream What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? I am testing with the private beta version of codenameone in Mac OS X using the following file: CodenameOne_Mac_20120218.dmg My OS is Mac Lion. (Version 10.7.3) Please provide any additional information below. It seems, the -pre-compile target is overridden in the generated build.xml file in the netbeans codenameone project. This file has source and target for the javac target set to 1.1 and it generates the class files in build/tmp dir. However later the do-compile target compiles the source files again and generates the files in build/classes dir. the class file generated in the build/tmp dir does not contain reference to classes not supported in CLDC1.1 aPI. However for the same source file, the class file generated in build/classes dir contains reference to the unsupported java.io.FilterInputStream class and hence this class file fails during server build.
issues.title: Build in netbeans uses source target other then 1.1

getProperty should implement the following key values pairs

"User-Agent" - returns the device user agent example:
for ipod the String looks like this - 
"Mozilla/5.0 (iPod; U; CPU iPhone OS 4_3_3 like Mac OS X; en-us) AppleWebKit/533.17.9 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/5.0.2 Mobile/8J2 Safari/6533.18.5"

"IMEI" - the International Mobile Equipment Identity (IMEI) number

"UDID" - Device Unique identifier

"MSISDN" - the device phone number (not sure if this is available)

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Fixed regression in SpanLabel that caused applying alignment to the text style to have no effect.  This was caused by https://github.com/codenameone/CodenameOne/commit/5c3174813a149da9865323285d877408c355bf29 which aligned SpanLabel text vertically centered with the icon by default.  The problem was that this was achieved using a FlowLayout with vertical center alignment, but FlowLayout doesn't fill the bounds of the TextArea to fit its parent, so alignment within the TextArea would have no meaning anymore.  Unfortunately there was no layout that would achieve the effect that I wanted (vertically centered, but filling the child bounds horizontally), so I added support for this in BoxLayout.
BoxLayout now includes an align property that will cause children to be laid out with a particular vertical alignment.  Y_AXIS supports CENTER and BOTTOM values for this. X_AXIS supports CENTER and RIGHT values for this.  This alignment has no effect if the children fill the the container.  It is only for aligning the empty space.  With this change, I was able to use a BoxLayout.Y with center alignment to wrap the TextArea and achieve the effect that I desired.
Added a sample to test the regression which was provided in https://github.com/codenameone/CodenameOne/issues/2891.
Also added unit tests for BoxLayout which can serve as a sample and prevent future regressions.

issues.body:
On Android (tested on Android 6/Nexus 5 device), cookies aren't stored when the URL contains an explicit port number.

E.g.  "http://example.com/mypage.php" will work.  "http://example.com:80/mypage.php" will not.

Patch forthcoming.

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Add support for instantly killing connections when kill() is called on them so that they don't continue to block the queue. https://github.com/codenameone/CodenameOne/issues/1430

issues.title: kill on a network connection request should abort the connection
issues.body: We need a system to kill a network request which user wants to abort. It seems, since the NetworkManager has one network thread by default, if you call ConnectionRequest.kill() method it cancels(marks it as killed) the connection request, but the networkThread is not interrupted and it keeps waiting till the request times out or response is returned by the server. So if you call kill on a connection request and then add another connection request in the queue, the new connection request will not work until the NetworkThread is free again to process this new request. The system should abort a connection request which is pending response from server when user calls the public api kill() and it should abort the request immediately and free up the network thread in Network Manager.

issues.title: iOS: Animations still running while app is background
issues.body: Original [issue 1411](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1411) created by codenameone on 2015-03-24T07:42:22.000Z: Please clearly state whether the issue relates to a device/the simulator or the tools. If related to a device be sure to specify exactly which device with as much details as possible. the problems is on iOS. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. I created a plain project with a form with a Timeline image. 2. Run in on iOS simulator and locked the device. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Animations should stop while app is in background, but debugging shows, that com_codename1_ui_Form_repaintAnimations was still called and also CPU activity was something like 2% What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? The latest buildserver build. Please provide any additional information below. I also discussed the issue in forum and Shai suggested to file an issue: https://groups.google.com/forum/embed/?place=forum/codenameone-discussions&showsearch=true&showpopout=true&hl=en&parenturl=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.codenameone.com%2Fdiscussion-forum.html#!topic/codenameone-discussions/y10IxD_4Kvw

Original [issue 1200](https://code.google.com/p/codenameone/issues/detail?id=1200) created by codenameone on 2014-10-01T14:27:01.000Z: IPlease clearly state whether the issue relates to a device/the simulator or the tools. iOS devices If related to a device be sure to specify exactly which device with as much details as possible. iPad 2 (iOS ver 8.0.2), iPhone 4 (iOS ver 7.1.2 and iPod Touch running iOS ver 6.1.6) In iPhone port, when you have two TextFields in a form and you click on other textField, the text from the other field is shown briefly. Let me give an example: Form A has two TextFields F1 and F2. When you click on F1 and then click on F2, it briefly shows the text from F1, before showing the text of F2. Also when one of the field is a password field and you enter some text in it and move to another field. Then come back on the first field and try to enter some more letters. In that case it clears the previous inputed values. Also sometimes the field is becoming blank and when you click on other field and then when you click back on the field, it shows the value. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Have a Form with two or more TextFields 2. 3. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The TextFields should not show value or hitText from other fields. The password TextField should retain value when user clicks on it again to enter more chars. The TextField should not become blank when user clicks on other field. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Latest version of Codenameone on Mac OS. Please provide any additional information below. This issue is created as per the discussion on following topic: http://www.codenameone.com/discussion-forum.html?place=topic%2Fcodenameone-discussions%2FobCqt9y8kDs%2Fdiscussion
issues.title: iOS port shows the text or hint text from another TextField on the form
